0.title: Akshay got home-cooked food daily, took orders from us: Raksha Bandhan actor
0.article_body: 'Raksha Bandhan' actor Sahil Mehta said that actor Akshay Kumar used to get home-cooked food for team everyday. "He would take orders from us (actors playing his sisters and me) on what to cook for tomorrow as he would inform his team, 'Ask them to cook this tomorrow'. We were served rajma chawal, cakes and what not," he added.

1.title: 'Laga chunari mein daag', sings Anil Vij while reacting to Congress' protest
1.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Saturday reacted to Congress’ protest in black clothes. On being asked about the protest, Vij sang, "Laga chunari mein daag, chhupau kaise...bach jaau kaise?" "The main problem is this," he added. Earlier, Congress leaders used to wear white clothes but with time their clothes have become black because of their "black deeds," Vij stated.

2.title: Pooja, your medal calls for celebrations, not apology: PM on CWG bronze medallist's video
2.article_body: Reacting to a video wherein wrestler Pooja Gehlot got emotional during a press conference and apologised to the countrymen for winning bronze medal instead of gold at CWG 2022, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Pooja...your medal calls for celebrations, not an apology." He added, "Your life journey motivates us, your success gladdens us. You are destined for great things ahead...keep shining!"

3.title: LetsVenture joins govt scheme to invest $100,000 in startups
3.article_body: Investor syndicate platform LetsVenture has collaborated with the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology's SAMRIDH scheme to help early-stage startups secure $100,000 in funds. LetsVenture was selected under Accelerator programme earlier this year. The venture capital firm said it will support eight startups in the first phase with focus on sectors like deep-tech, gaming and fintech.

4.title: Gurugram class 9 boy dies by electrocution, dad says 'No doctor was present'
4.article_body: A class nine student died after he was allegedly electrocuted while he was returning from school in Gurugram. His father said the 14-year-old boy was rushed to hospital from where he was referred to another hospital but no doctor was present in emergency ward. "He kept lying there for 25 minutes...By the time I reached...he had died," his father said.

5.title: Being tolerant of others' opinions doesn’t mean blind conformity: Justice Chandrachud
5.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said that being accepting or tolerant of others’ opinions does not mean "blind conformity" or "not standing up against hate speech". "The words famously attributed to Voltaire, ‘I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to death your right to say it’ must be incorporated into our being," Justice Chandrachud added.

6.title: ISRO's smallest rocket SSLV suffers data loss in final phase after launch
6.article_body: Shortly after the launch of ISRO's smallest commercial rocket SSLV on Sunday, Chairman S Somanath said that while the rocket performed all stages, it suffered some data loss in the terminal phase of the mission. He added, "We are analysing the data to conclude the final outcome of the mission with respect to achieving a stable orbit."

7.title: When Alia and I started dating, we couldn't tell Ayan Mukerji: Ranbir
7.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed that he did not tell filmmaker Ayan Mukerji about his relationship with Alia Bhatt in the beginning. "We couldn't even tell Ayan that we'd started seeing each other, fearing that he would freak out," he said. "Alia, Ayan...I have spent so much time making 'Brahmastra'...so much has changed in our lives over the years," Ranbir added.

8.title: Next target is World Championships: Ravi Dahiya after CWG gold
8.article_body: After winning the gold in the men's freestyle 57kg event at CWG 2022, wrestler Ravi Dahiya said his next target is to bag the gold medal at the World Wrestling Championships. "I came here (CWG 2022) to win a gold medal...and achieved it. My next target is World Championships," he stated. Dahiya had won bronze in the 2019 World Championships.

9.title: Don't want to make filthy film, want to make family entertainers: Akshay
9.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that he wants to try his hand at different types of content. However, the actor added, "I don't want to make a ghinoni (filthy) film. Even if it is a psycho-thriller movie or a social drama, it should be viewed by families without any hesitancy." Akshay will next be seen in 'Raksha Bandhan'.

10.title: Man arrested for posing as Lawrence Bishnoi's gang member in Panipat
10.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly posing as a member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang and demanding ₹20 lakh extortion from a trader in Haryana's Panipat. The accused has been identified as a resident of Vidhyanand colony who runs a mobile repair and accessory shop. He had threatened to kill the victim's family if the money was not paid.

11.title: US supports Israel's right to defend itself, urges de-escalation
11.article_body: Responding to the recent exchange of fires between Israel and Gaza, US State Department said on Saturday that it supports Israel's right to defend itself. US urged all sides to de-escalate and expressed concern over reports of civilian deaths, calling for "a timely and thorough" probe. Gaza Health Ministry said at least 24 Palestinians, including six children, have been killed.

12.title: Rapper Young Slo-Be shot dead at the age of 29 in California
12.article_body: Rapper Young Slo-Be was shot dead at the age of 29 in California, US, the company which worked with Slo-Be confirmed. "This senseless act of violence has taken a man from his family and leaves a huge void in...music community," Thizzler On The Roof said. Slo-Be was the artist behind 'I Love You', a song that went viral on TikTok.

13.title: US Democrats' climate and health care bill gets Senate's nod
13.article_body: US Senate has passed Democrats' Inflation Reduction Act by 51-50 votes with US Vice President Kamala Harris casting the deciding vote. The bill allocates $370 billion towards clean energy and climate at a time when heatwaves and floods have been witnessed across the country. Bill also aims to make changes to Medicare to negotiate prices of certain costly prescribed drugs.

14.title: India reports 18,738 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate at 5.02%
14.article_body: India reports 18,738 new COVID-19 cases and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, including 8 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,34,933, while the daily positivity rate stood at 5.02%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,689.

15.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway posts $43.8 billion loss in Q2 earnings
15.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway, led by the world's eighth richest person Warren Buffett, reported a $43.8 billion loss in its second-quarter earnings. The company attributed the loss to disruptions caused by COVID-19 and geopolitical conflicts including Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Berkshire also repurchased $1 billion of its own stock in the quarter and has repurchased $4.2 billion this year.

16.title: Security increased, Delhi Police use face recognition software before I-Day
16.article_body: Security in Delhi has been increased ahead of India's 75th Independence Day. A drive involving Delhi Police making use of facial recognition software (FRS) on "vagabonds" or "people with suspicious movement" was launched a month ago. "[Police] have been taking pictures and details of 'vagabonds' like their names, ages, native places, reason for shifting, and period of stay," police said.

17.title: 8 killed, 22 injured in bomb blast in shopping street in Kabul; IS claims responsibility
17.article_body: A bomb blast in a busy shopping street in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Saturday killed eight people and injured 22, officials said. The bomb exploded in an area of the city where members of the minority Shi'ite Muslim community regularly meet. Islamic State, a Sunni Muslim militant group, claimed responsibility for the attack, the group said on its Telegram channel.

18.title: Sagar Ahlawat reaches men's super heavyweight boxing final at CWG
18.article_body: Boxer Sagar Ahlawat has reached the gold medal bout at CWG 2022 by defeating Nigeria's Ifeanyi Onyekwere in the semi-final of the men's over 92kg (super heavyweight) category. Sagar is the fourth Indian boxer to reach the gold medal bout in the ongoing games after Nikhat Zareen, Amit Panghal and Nitu Ghanghas. He'll face England's Delicious Orie in the final.

19.title: Can anything be more preposterous?: Cong leader on protest linked to Ram Mandir
19.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Kumar Bansal reacted to Union Home Minister Amit Shah linking the party’s protest to Ram Mandir’s foundation day. "Can anything be more preposterous than the allegation that the Congress organised a protest against price rise on August 5, as the foundation stone of Ram Temple was laid on this day?" Bansal tweeted.

20.title: ISRO launches its smallest rocket SSLV carrying satellite made by 750 school girls
20.article_body: The ISRO today launched its smallest commercial rocket, SSLV, from Sriharikota. It is designed to carry satellites up to 500 kg and is a low-cost vehicle due to its low turnaround time. It is carrying an Earth Observation Satellite and AzadiSAT, a satellite built by 750 school girls from across India to mark the 75th Independence Day.

21.title: Govt worshipping 'Raavan' in name of 'Ram': Congress' Adhir Chowdhury
21.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury reacted to Union Minister Amit Shah linking the party’s protest to Ram Mandir’s foundation day. "In the name of 'Ram', this government has been worshipping 'Raavan'," Chowdhury said. The Congress leader further said, "People are afflicted under their rule." Congress "exposed" this government as anti-people and pro-corporate, Chowdhury stated.

22.title: Early Amazon investor & board member Tom Alberg passes away aged 82
22.article_body: Tom Alberg, the Founder of Seattle-based venture capital company Madrona Venture Group, has passed away at the age of 82 after suffering a stroke last month. Alberg was an early Amazon investor and served as its board member for 23 years. Condoling his death, Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos tweeted, "Tom was a visionary and also just a wonderful, good man."

23.title: I look up to Ajay Devgn's career as a reference point: Arjun Kapoor
23.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said that he looks up to actor Ajay Devgn's career as a reference point. "For me, he is an inspiration. The way he has managed to cultivate his audience," the 'Ek Villain Returns' actor added. "Subconsciously, I've always meandered towards following his career...I would like to learn from him," Arjun further stated.

24.title: Was trolled in school for being raised by single parent, there was rage: Masaba
24.article_body: Actress Masaba Gupta said that she was trolled in school for being raised by a single parent and the nature of her parents' relationship. "But I was like, 'Your father, your mother are everywhere. That's allowed?' There was a lot of rage that time but now I just laugh it off," she added.

25.title: I feel good because I didn't do well in the last two games: Avesh on 2/17 vs WI
25.article_body: India pacer Avesh Khan said he's feeling good after being named 'Player of the Match' in the fourth T20I against West Indies as he couldn't do well in previous games in the five-match series. "My coaches and my captain told me that they were backing me," he added. Avesh registered figures of 0/47 and 1/31 in the last two games.

26.title: 4 people shot dead in US' Ohio, FBI releases pics of suspect and his vehicle
26.article_body: FBI has released details of a suspect named Stephen A Marlow, who allegedly killed four people including an old couple and a mother-daughter in Ohio on Friday. Marlow was described as 5'11" and about 160 pounds, with brown hair. Authorities believe Marlow, 39, was wearing shorts and a yellow T-shirt and fled in a white 2007 Ford Edge.

27.title: PMC to set up incinerators to dispose of fish, chicken, mutton waste
27.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to separately collect fish, chicken and mutton waste from sellers. The civic body plans to set up a new incinerator facility to dispose of this waste. PMC said that a separate collection system will be put in place. An official said that as per existing practice, this waste is mixed with all other waste.

28.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 14 medals in 1 day?
28.article_body: India clinched 14 medals on Day 9 of CWG 2022, including four gold medals. India have won 13 gold medals at the Games so far and are currently placed fifth on the medal standings. Second-placed England became the second country after leaders Australia to bag at least 50 gold medals. Canada are placed third with 22 gold medals.

29.title: Who were India's medallists on Day 9 of CWG 2022 as country bags 14 medals?
29.article_body: Wrestlers Vinesh Phogat, Ravi Dahiya and Naveen clinched gold on Day 9 of CWG 2022. Bhavina Patel bagged para table tennis gold. Athletes Priyanka Goswami and Avinash Sable, and Indian men's fours lawn bowls team bagged silver. Wrestlers Pooja Gehlot, Pooja Sihag & Deepak Nehra, boxers Jaismine, Hussamuddin and Rohit Tokas, and para table tennis player Sonalben Patel won bronze.

30.title: I apologise to countrymen, wished National Anthem be played here: Pooja on her CWG bronze
30.article_body: Wrestler Pooja Gehlot, who won India a bronze medal in the women's freestyle 50 kg category at CWG 2022, got emotional during a press conference. In the press conference, she said, "I apologise to my countrymen. It was my wish that National Anthem be played here [because of me]." She added, "I'll learn from my mistakes and work on them."

31.title: Elon Musk challenges Twitter CEO Parag to public debate on bots amid legal battle
31.article_body: Elon Musk has challenged Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal to a public debate about the percentage of bots on Twitter amid the ongoing legal battle over $44-billion buyout deal. "Let him prove...that Twitter has <5% fake or spam daily users," Musk tweeted. He also started a poll asking users whether less than 5% of Twitter's daily users are fake or spam.

32.title: Mobile data services suspended in Manipur, Sec 144 in 2 districts after van set ablaze
32.article_body: Mobile data services have been suspended in Manipur for five days after an eco-van was set ablaze by three-four youths, an order by state government said. Section 144 has been imposed in Churachandpur and Bishnupur districts for next two months. The order said that "the crime has created tense communal situation and volatile law and order situation in the state".

33.title: Bhavina Patel creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win gold in para table tennis at CWG
33.article_body: Para table tennis player Bhavina Patel created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win gold medal in para table tennis at CWG. The 35-year-old defeated Nigeria's Ifechukwude Christiana Ikpeoyi in the final of the women's singles classes 3-5 event at CWG 2022. Bhavina had bagged silver at Tokyo Paralympics, which was India's first-ever Paralympic medal in para table tennis.

34.title: India record their 13th consecutive series win vs West Indies in international cricket
34.article_body: India defeated West Indies by 59 runs in the fourth T20I in Florida to take an unassailable 3-1 lead in the five-match series. With this, India recorded their fifth consecutive T20I series victory against West Indies. It is also India's 13th consecutive series victory against West Indies across formats in international cricket.

35.title: Indian wrestler Deepak Nehra defeats Pakistan's Tayab Raza to bag bronze at CWG 2022
35.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Nehra defeated Pakistan's Tayab Raza in the men's freestyle 97 kg event to bag a bronze medal at CWG 2022. With this, India bagged six medals in wrestling at CWG 2022 on Day 9, including three gold and three bronze medals. Overall, India bagged 12 medals in wrestling at CWG 2022.

36.title: India reach men's hockey final for the third time in CWG history
36.article_body: India defeated South Africa 3-2 in men's hockey semi-final at CWG 2022 to reach the final for the third time in the history of CWG. Abhishek, Mandeep Singh and Jugraj Singh scored for India in the semi-final. India will face either Australia or England in the final on Monday. India won silver in the 2010 and 2014 editions of CWG.

37.title: Mohammad Hussamuddin bags India's 2nd boxing medal of the day at CWG 2022
37.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammad Hussamuddin bagged India's second boxing medal of the day at CWG 2022. The 28-year-old lost to Ghana's Joseph Commey in the semi-final of the men's over 54kg-57kg (featherweight) to settle for the bronze. Earlier today, India's Jaismine had won bronze in the women's over 57kg-60kg (lightweight) category.

38.title: US prepares $1 billion weapons package for Ukraine: Report
38.article_body: The President Joe Biden-led US government's next security aid package for Ukraine will be worth around $1 billion, Reuters reported quoting officials. It will reportedly include armoured medical vehicles and munitions for long-range weapons. The US has already given Ukraine aid of about  $8.8 billion since Russia's invasion began on February 24.

39.title: Ukraine detains 2 accused of identifying targets for Russian strikes
39.article_body: Ukraine's State Security Service (SBU) said on Saturday that it has detained two suspected Russian intelligence agents who had identified targets for missile strikes that damaged shipbuilding infrastructure in Mykolaiv. SBU said the accused "collected and transmitted intelligence to the enemy about important infrastructure facilities...and movement of personnel and equipment" of Ukrainian forces.

40.title: Chinese ship to dock in Hambantota for refuelling: Sri Lanka
40.article_body: Chinese research vessel 'Yuan Wang 5' will dock at Hambantota Port in Sri Lanka next week to seek "refuelling and replenishment", Sri Lankan Minister Bandula Gunawardana has said. He reiterated Colombo will not do "anything to harm the good understanding" between India and Sri Lanka. Earlier, India's defence establishment said it would closely follow the visit of the Chinese ship.

41.title: Pakistan Army chief reaches out to Saudi, UAE for financial aid
41.article_body: Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Bajwa has reached out to Saudi Arabia and the UAE to seek financial assistance for Pakistan. The International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Executive Board is set to meet later this month to approve a package of $1.2 billion for Pakistan. Islamabad is in talks with friendly nations to provide supporting funds ahead of the IMF package.

42.title: Pooja Sihag bags bronze as all 6 Indian female wrestlers win medals at CWG 2022
42.article_body: India's 25-year-old wrestler Pooja Sihag defeated Australia's Naomi de Bruine in women's freestyle 76 kg category to bag bronze at CWG 2022. With this, all the six Indian female wrestlers bagged medals at CWG 2022. Anshu Malik bagged silver, while Sakshi Malik and Vinesh Phogat bagged gold medals in their respective categories. Pooja Gehlot and Divya Kakran bagged bronze medals.

43.title: 2 missing girls aged between 4-5 found dead in well in MP
43.article_body: The bodies of two girls were found in a well in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday. The girls had gone missing from their homes in Khargone on Friday, following which an abduction case was registered, a police officer said. "The girls [were] in the four-five age group. Prima facie, it seems they accidentally fell into the well and drowned," he added.

44.title: Maharashtra logs 1,931 new COVID-19 cases, 9 deaths reported
44.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,931 fresh cases of COVID-19 and nine deaths due to the infection on Saturday, the state health department said. Saturday's cases took Maharashtra's active case count to 11,875. Maharashtra's current positivity rate stands at 4.77 per cent, news agency PTI reported. On Friday, the state had reported 2,024 COVID-19 cases and five fatalities due to the virus.

45.title: He is happy to be here: Klopp after Mo Salah renews his Liverpool contract
45.article_body: After forward Mohamed Salah signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool, the English football club's manager Juergen Klopp said that the 30-year-old Egyptian "is in really good shape" and "is happy to be here (Liverpool)". "After a few weeks of holiday, Mo is always full of power...He looked really sharp in the whole pre-season... May it continue," Klopp said.

46.title: Roopali Desai becomes 1st Indian-American judge on US' 9th Circuit
46.article_body: The US Senate has confirmed Arizona lawyer Roopali Desai as the first Indian-American judge on the 9th US Circuit Court of Appeals. Desai was confirmed by the Senate by a bipartisan vote of 67-29 on Thursday. The 9th Circuit, which is the largest of the thirteen courts of appeals, has jurisdiction over nine states and two territories.

47.title: Will defend Philippines if it's attacked in the South China Sea: US
47.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken on Saturday said that the US would come to the defence of the Philippines if it faces hostilities in the South China Sea. Referring to an "ironclad" defence pact between the two countries, Blinken stated, "An armed attack on Philippine armed forces, public vessels and aircraft will invoke US mutual defence commitments under that treaty."

48.title: 19-year-old Naveen defeats Pakistan's Tahir to win India's 12th gold at CWG 2022
48.article_body: India's 19-year-old wrestler Naveen defeated Pakistan's Muhammad Sharif Tahir to bag gold in the men's freestyle 74 kg event, taking India's gold medal tally at CWG 2022 to 12. India have now won a total of 34 medals at CWG 2022, including 11 silver and 11 bronze medals. As many as six Indian wrestlers won gold at CWG 2022.

49.title: Pic shows underwater fog in Mexico, photographer says 'It's like another world'
49.article_body: Divers exploring the caverns of Mexico shared photos of the descent into swirling fog caused by alternating layers of fresh water and salt water, creating the illusion of a river underwater. Underwater photographer Francis Perez dived into a cenote called 'El Pit' in Yucatan, Mexico. "It's like flying over a river...It's like another world, a mysterious place," said Perez.

50.title: Sharath enters men's, mixed doubles finals, assures India of 2 more CWG medals
50.article_body: Table tennis player Sharath Kamal assured India of at least two more medals at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham. The 40-year-old reached the finals of both the men's doubles and mixed doubles on Saturday. Sharath and Sathiyan Gnanasekaran won the men's doubles semi-final 3-2. Later, Sharath and Sreeja Akula won the mixed doubles semi-final 3-2.

51.title: What a steady rise to the top Dahiya: Anurag Thakur on wrestler's CWG gold
51.article_body: Reacting to Indian wrestler Ravi Dahiya's gold medal at CWG 2022, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter and wrote, "What a steady rise to the top Ravi Dahiya!" He added, "An Olympic silver last year topped with a CWG gold in 2022, you are truly on a roll." Dahiya won gold in men's freestyle 57 kg final on Saturday.

52.title: Taxi driver arrested for molesting female tourist in Goa
52.article_body: A taxi driver was arrested for allegedly molesting a female tourist on Saturday. The woman had hired the accused's cab to travel to Anjuna after landing at the airport on Friday night, police said. The accused, Mithun Gaur, allegedly touched the complainant inappropriately when she was getting down from the car at Anjuna, police added.

53.title: Policeman beaten by 10-12 men inside police station in Delhi, video surfaces
53.article_body: A video of a policeman being beaten up inside Delhi's Anand Vihar police station has been widely shared online. The clip shows an on-duty head constable being surrounded and assaulted as he sits with folded hands, while no one is seen intervening to stop the miscreants. The incident reportedly took place on August 3 (Wednesday).

54.title: Harshal Patel to miss Asia Cup, doubtful for T20 WC 2022: Report
54.article_body: Indian pacer Harshal Patel is reportedly likely to miss the upcoming Asia Cup tournament and may not even feature in this year's T20 World Cup too. Patel is having a side strain, which needs four-six weeks of rehab, a report said. The 31-year-old is currently with the Indian team in the US for the five-match T20I series against WI.

55.title: City bus submerges in water amid heavy rainfall in Odisha, 20 rescued
55.article_body: A city bus submerged in water at Jatni Pipili Railway underpass in the Khordha district of Odisha on Saturday. This comes as waterlogging was reported in the area amid heavy rainfall. More than 20 passengers were rescued by the public, ANI reported. A video of the incident showed two-three men helping a man in the water.

56.title: I thank all those MPs who voted for Jagdeep Dhankhar in VP poll: PM
56.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday thanked all the Members of Parliament who voted for Jagdeep Dhankhar in the Vice Presidential election. "At a time when India marks Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, we are proud to be having a Kisan Putra Vice President who has excellent legal knowledge and intellectual prowess," he said. PM Modi met Dhankhar to congratulate him.

57.title: Turkey to pay for Russian gas partially in rubles
57.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Saturday said his country will partially pay for Russian gas in rubles and will also extend the use of Russia's Mir payment system. This comes amid the US' international push to sanction Russia after its invasion of Ukraine. Erdogan made the announcements after meeting Russian President Vladimir Putin in Sochi.

58.title: Rohit overtakes Afridi to record 2nd most number of sixes in international cricket
58.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has overtaken Shahid Afridi to record second-most number of sixes in international cricket. With his three sixes in the fourth West Indies T20I, Rohit took his tally of sixes in international cricket to 477. Afridi slammed 476 sixes in 508 innings. With 553 sixes, Chris Gayle holds the record for hitting most sixes in international cricket.

59.title: PM Modi meets Jagdeep Dhankhar, says 'proud to have Kisan Putra VP'
59.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid a visit to Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday to congratulate him soon after the latter was elected as India's Vice President. In a statement, PM Modi said, "We are proud to be having a Kisan Putra Vice President who has excellent legal knowledge and intellectual prowess." BJP President JP Nadda also met Dhankhar following his victory.

60.title: Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' screened at Parliament
60.article_body: Several leaders of the Bharatiya Janata Party attended a special screening of R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' at the Parliament on Friday. Madhavan, who has directed and produced the film in addition to acting in it, said, "I am eternally grateful that the film was so well received." The film is based on former ISRO scientist Nambi Narayanan.

61.title: Kevin Feige wanted to kill all 6 Avengers in Endgame: Joe Russo
61.article_body: 'Avengers: Endgame' co-director Joe Russo revealed that Marvel President Kevin Feige wanted not two, but all six of the original Avengers dead in the film. "Kevin [pitched]...taking all...OGs off the board," he said, adding he and Anthony Russo felt Kevin's pitch was "way too aggressive". Robert Downey Jr's Iron Man and Scarlett Johansson's Black Widow were killed in the movie.

62.title: Proud that Indian flag soared because of me: Priyanka on CWG race walk silver
62.article_body: Priyanka Goswami, who became the first-ever Indian woman to win a silver medal in 10,000 metres race walk at CWG, said she's very proud that the Indian flag soared because of her. "I'm elated," she added. The 26-year-old clocked 43:38.83, her personal best, to win silver on Saturday. Overall, this is India's second medal in race walk at CWG.

63.title: UN chief attends 77th anniversary of atomic bombing in Japan
63.article_body: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres joined Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida at the Hiroshima Peace Park on Saturday to remember the world's first atomic bombing 77 years ago. "Nuclear weapons are nonsense. They guarantee...only death and destruction," Guterres said. US on August 6, 1945, dropped the world's first atomic bomb on Japan, killing 1,40,000 people.

64.title: Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat wins her 3rd gold medal in CWG history
64.article_body: India's 27-year-old wrestler Vinesh Phogat bagged gold medal in the women's freestyle 53 kg category at CWG 2022. Phogat won the gold after winning each of her three matches in the Nordic System group. She beat Canada's Samantha Stewart, Nigeria's Mercy Bolafunoluwa Adekuoroye and Sri Lanka's Chamodya Keshani Maduravalage Don. Vinesh has now won three gold medals in CWG history.

65.title: Ex-Union Minister RCP Singh quits JD(U) amid corruption allegations by party
65.article_body: Hours after Janata Dal (United) reportedly sought an explanation from party leader RCP Singh over corruption allegations against him, the former Union Minister quit the Nitish Kumar-led party. "The allegations are a conspiracy by those who envied my getting inducted into the Union cabinet...Those living in glass houses must not hurl stones at others," Singh said at a press conference.

66.title: I don't hate Vivian; if I dislike someone, why would I've baby with them: Neena
66.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said in an interview that even though she has moved on from her previous relationships, she has never hated her exes. "I believe once you love somebody, how can you hate?" she added. Referring to former West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, Neena said, "If I dislike someone, why would I've a baby with them? Am I mad?"

67.title: Naxalites kill man suspecting him to be a police informer in MP
67.article_body: Naxalites have murdered a man in MP's Balaghat district following suspicion that he was a police informer, an official said on Saturday. The deceased, Lalu Dhurve, was in his late 20s, police said, adding such acts are intended to create fear among the locals. Police said the Naxalites left behind pamphlets, claiming Dhurve was a police informer.

68.title: It's 74%; Let it sink in: BL Santhosh on Dhankar's win in VP polls
68.article_body: BJP's National General Secretary (Organisation) BL Santhosh has commented on the NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar's win in the Vice-President polls. "Dhankhar wins VP elections by securing 528 of the 725 votes," Santhosh said. He added, "It's 74%. Let it sink in. From [a] farm background, distinguished legal luminary will add further value [to] the luminaries who occupied that chair."

69.title: Assam reports 3 deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis, 12 new cases
69.article_body: Three deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis were recorded in Assam on Saturday, as per a release issued by the National Health Mission. According to the release, the state also reported 12 new cases of the infection during the day. Saturday's cases took Assam's tally of Japanese Encephalitis cases reported since the beginning of July to 347.

70.title: The man is also going to have a child: Alia on her reaction to post about her pregnancy
70.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who had criticised a report claiming her pregnancy might delay her Hollywood career, said, "You're not saying that about the man, the man is also going to have the child...Why is it only for the woman?" "You are making a commentary on a woman in general, who is actually working since the beginning of (her) pregnancy," she added.

71.title: Maybe it's not my time, maybe I lack something: Dhawan on not being considered for T20Is
71.article_body: Talking about not being considered by selectors for T20Is, Shikhar Dhawan said, "I feel that there is a time for everything, and maybe it's not my time." He added, "Maybe I lack something that I haven't been able to do too well." He further said, "I gave my best and that's what matters...I am in a very good space."

72.title: Manika Batra's CWG 2022 campaign ends after loss in women's doubles
72.article_body: Indian duo of Manika Batra and Diya Chitale lost in quarter-final of the women's doubles table tennis event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Saturday. Charlotte Carey and Anna Hursey of Wales defeated the Indian team 11-7, 11-6, 11-13, 12-10. With this, Manika's campaign has ended at the ongoing Commonwealth Games. Notably, Manika won four medals in the 2018 edition.

73.title: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya bags India's 10th gold medal at CWG 2022
73.article_body: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya won the men's freestyle 57 kg event on Saturday to bag India's 10th gold medal at Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. The 24-year-old, who had won a silver medal at Tokyo Olympics last year, defeated Nigeria's Ebikewenimo Welson in the final to win his first CWG medal. Out of India's 10 gold medals, four have come from wrestling.

74.title: NMC invites persecuted minorities from Pak to practise medicine in India
74.article_body: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has invited applications from persecuted minorities from Pakistan, who escaped from the country and entered India on or before December 31, 2014, to practise medicine here. The NMC has invited applications from such people who have obtained Indian citizenship for the grant of permanent registration to practise modern medicine or allopathy.

75.title: Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as VP: TN CM
75.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the Vice President of India. "Hope the ideals enshrined in our constitution will be upheld during your tenure besides strengthening the democratic debates in the Upper House," he said. The voting for the Vice Presidential polls was held today.

76.title: Man gets 10 years in prison for minor's rape in Maharashtra's Latur
76.article_body: A special Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act court in Maharashtra's Latur awarded a 10-year prison sentence to a 50-year-old man for the rape of a minor girl in 2017. The girl was raped by Amol alias Ratnakar Baburao Prayag on January 30, 2017 when she went to the latter's house along with his daughter to play.

77.title: Mob attacks man with swords, hockey sticks for supporting Nupur Sharma in Maha
77.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly attacked by around 14 people carrying swords, sickle, hockey sticks etc in Maharashtra after he showed support for suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police said. Pratik alias Sunny Rajendra Pawar sustained serious injuries on his head and other body parts in the attack. Four people have been detained in connection to the August 4 incident.

78.title: Her husband wanted a son, dowry: Sister of Indian-origin woman who died by suicide in US
78.article_body: The sister of Mandeep Kaur, the Indian-origin woman who died by suicide after eight years of domestic abuse, said her husband Ranjotveer Sandhu started 'torturing' Mandeep as soon as they moved to New York. "He wanted a son and ₹50 lakh dowry," said Kuldeep Kaur. Mandeep's father alleged Sandhu's parents didn't intervene even after they were told about the abuse.

79.title: Congrats to Dhankhar, thank you Alva for representing Opp'n: Rahul
79.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the Vice-President after the latter won the polls by a margin of 346 votes on Saturday. "Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the 14th Vice-President of India...Thank you to Margaret Alva for representing the spirit of the joint Opposition with grace and dignity," Rahul tweeted.

80.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar will be an outstanding Vice President: Piyush Goyal
80.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on winning the Vice Presidential elections. "He'll be a wonderful Rajya Sabha Chairman [and] an outstanding Vice President," Goyal said. "The nation is blessed to have the son of a farmer and an eminent jurist as VP of India. We're fortunate we'll have a chance to work with him," he added.

81.title: At least 67 injured after explosion at Cuban fuel storage facility
81.article_body: Fire from the oil tank that was hit by lightning on Friday caused another fuel storage tank to explode near Cuba's supertanker port in Matanzas on Saturday morning. At least 67 people were injured in the blast on Saturday, Cuban state media reported. Notably, this comes at a time when Cuba is already facing daily blackouts and fuel shortages.

82.title: Pooja Gehlot becomes 7th Indian wrestler to win a medal at CWG 2022
82.article_body: India's 25-year-old wrestler Pooja Gehlot has become the seventh Indian wrestler to win a medal at the CWG 2022. Gehlot won a bronze medal in the women's freestyle 50 kg after beating Scotland's Christelle Lemofack Letchidjio 12-2. Overall, India have won 31 medals at CWG 2022 so far.

83.title: Alva congratulates Dhankhar, says 'some Opp'n parties supported BJP'
83.article_body: After Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as the Vice-President of India, Opposition candidate Margaret Alva congratulated him and thanked the MPs who voted for her. Alva wrote on Twitter, "This election was an opportunity for the Opposition to work together...Unfortunately, some Opposition parties chose to directly or indirectly support the BJP...in an attempt to derail the idea of a united Opposition."

84.title: Anil shares pic from 1984 film Mashaal, asks fans to 'guess the actors'
84.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor took to Instagram on Saturday to share a throwback picture from his 1984 film 'Mashaal'. "What rolling into the weekend looks like...I love this pic...Guess the names of the other actors," he wrote alongside the picture. Sanjay Kapoor commented on the post, "Gulshan Grover, Madan Jain, Raj Hans." "It's not Raj Hans," Anil replied.

85.title: Indian shuttler Aakarshi loses in singles semis, crashes out of CWG 2022
85.article_body: India's badminton player Aakarshi Kashyap crashed out of the Commonwealth Games 2022 after losing in quarter-final of the women's singles event in Birmingham on Saturday. The 20-year-old lost 10-21, 7-21 to Scotland's Kirsty Gilmour, a silver and bronze medallist in the 2014 and 2018 editions respectively. With this, Aakarshi's debut campaign ended at the ongoing Commonwealth Games.

86.title: 70-year-old temple priest beaten to death while worshipping in UP
86.article_body: A 70-year-old priest was allegedly beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Sherkot on Saturday, police said. The deceased, Begram, was conducting rituals and worship at Manokamna Mandir around 4:30 am when some unknown assailants reportedly attacked him. After his wife came out hearing his screams, the attackers fled the spot. He was rushed to the hospital but declared brought dead.

87.title: China shouldn't hold global issues hostage: US State Secretary
87.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Saturday said China should not hold hostage discussions on important global issues, such as climate change. US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan recently, triggering a reaction from China which claims Taiwan as its own territory. In retaliation, Beijing cut contacts with Washington on vital issues of military importance and climate cooperation.

88.title: Iran calls for 'realistic' US response to revive nuclear deal
88.article_body: Iran on Saturday called on the US to come up with a "realistic" response to Tehran's proposals for reviving the 2015 nuclear deal, state media reported. This came as Tehran and Washington continued indirect talks for the third day in Vienna to salvage the pact. Under the deal, Iran agreed to limit its nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief.

89.title: Nation will benefit from Dhankhar's experience of public life: Prez
89.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Saturday tweeted, "Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected the Vice President of India." "The nation will benefit from your long and rich experience of public life. My best wishes for a productive and successful tenure," she said. Notably, Dhankar won by 346 votes as he received 528 of the total 725 votes that were cast.

90.title: Unknown illness killed 61 in Chhattisgarh village in 3 yrs, claim locals
90.article_body: Residents of a remote village in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district claimed 61 people died there in three years due to an unknown illness that causes swollen hands and legs. Preliminary results of water sample examination found high fluoride and iron content in it. "As of now, we cannot say...the deaths were caused due to heavy metal content," an official said.

91.title: Cannot avoid it: Akshay on Raksha Bandhan's clash with Laal Singh Chaddha
91.article_body: Akshay Kumar has said box office clashes between films will happen because of COVID-19. "There are a lot of films that are...completed but...were not able to come out," said Akshay, whose 'Raksha Bandhan' will release on August 11, the same day as Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Now you cannot avoid it...My hope is that both...movies do well," he added.

92.title: BJP uses 'its only weapon Ram' to divert people's attention: Adhir Chowdhury
92.article_body: After Union Minister Amit Shah said Congress insulted the 'Ram bhakts' by protesting in black clothes on Ayodhya Day, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury accused BJP of "resorting to their only weapon Ram" to "divert" the attention of the people from real issue. "It is our...responsibility to raise...issues of...people...But in the name of Amrit Kaal...government has been deceiving...people," he said.

93.title: Kohli, Hassan facing same problem; too much mental pressure: Hafeez
93.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Mohammad Hafeez said that Hassan Ali and Virat Kohli are facing the "same problem". "Kohli is one of the best players of the past 10 years...He needed a break because he had too much mental pressure," Hafeez said. He added, "The management was unfair to [Hassan]...he was played in matches where he could've been rested."

94.title: Election of 'Kisan Putra' Dhankhar as VP is a matter of joy: Shah
94.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar after he was elected as India's Vice-President (VP) on Saturday. Shah tweeted that the election of "Kisan Putra" Dhankhar as the VP is a matter of joy for India. "I'm sure that as Vice President and Chairman of Rajya Sabha [he'll] prove to be an ideal guardian of the Constitution," Shah added.

95.title: Gave financial aid to kin of 789 farmers who died during protest: Mann
95.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday said that his government has completed the process of providing financial assistance to families of 789 farmers who lost their lives during the agitation against the Centre's farm laws. Each family has been given ₹5 lakh. The farmers had died due to various reasons, including harsh winter, road accidents and cardiac arrest.

96.title: Dipika-Saurav lose in mixed doubles squash semis, to play for bronze at CWG
96.article_body: Dipika Pallikal and Saurav Ghosal lost in semi-final of the mixed doubles squash event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Saturday. The Indian duo lost to Joelle King and Paul Coll of New Zealand 7-11, 4-11. Dipika and Saurav will play in the bronze medal match on Sunday. Notably, Ghosal won bronze medal in men's singles on Wednesday.

97.title: Dalai Lama honoured with Ladakh's highest civilian award
97.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama was honoured with Ladakh's highest civilian honour 'dPal rNgam Duston' award for his contribution to humanity on Friday. The 87-year-old was conferred the award by Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council (LAHDC) in Leh on the occasion of Union Territory Declaration Day. LAHDC chief Tashi Gyalson appealed for the conferment of Bharat Ratna on Dalai Lama.

98.title: CISF jawan opens fire at India's largest museum in Kolkata, 1 killed & many hurt
98.article_body: A CISF jawan opened fire at Kolkata's Indian Museum, which is the largest and oldest museum in India, killing one person and injuring several others. Kolkata Police Commissioner said that one ASI was killed and one assistant commandant rank officer was among those injured. The accused jawan, who attacked around 6:30 pm on Saturday, has been captured.

99.title: Satyendar Jain's wife gets interim bail in money laundering case
99.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday granted interim bail to Poonam Jain, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's wife, in a money laundering case. The court directed Poonam to be released on bail on a personal bond of ₹1 lakh and noted that she wasn't arrested during investigation. Meanwhile, Satyendar, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate, also withdrew his interim bail application.

100.title: Confident Jagdeep Dhankhar will make an exceptional VP: Rajnath Singh
100.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on winning the Vice Presidential elections. "His long public life, wide experience and deep understanding of people's issues will certainly benefit the nation," Singh said in a tweet. "I am confident that he will make an exceptional VP & Rajya Sabha Chairman," he added.

101.title: Firing in India's largest museum in Kolkata, 1 killed & many injured
101.article_body: A CISF jawan opened fire at Kolkata's Indian Museum, which is the largest and oldest museum in India, killing one person and injuring several others. Kolkata Police Commissioner said that one ASI was killed and one assistant commandant rank officer was among those injured. The accused jawan, who attacked around 6:30 pm on Saturday, has been captured.

102.title: India announce their playing XI for 4th T20I against West Indies, make 3 changes
102.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the fourth T20I in Florida. India have made three changes to their playing XI, with Ravi Bishnoi, Axar Patel and Sanju Samson replacing Ravichandran Ashwin, Hardik Pandya and Shreyas Iyer. India lead the five-match series 2-1.

103.title: Israel and Palestinian militants exchange fire for 2nd day
103.article_body: Israeli airstrikes on the Gaza Strip and rocket attacks by Palestinian militants on Israel continued for the second day on Saturday. The latest exchange of fire started on Friday after Israel killed an Islamic Jihad commander in an airstrike on a high-rise building in the Palestinian territory. The militants fired at least 160 rockets across the border.

104.title: 20-year-old boxer Jaismine wins India's 30th medal at CWG 2022, clinches bronze
104.article_body: India's 20-year-old boxer Jaismine settled with a bronze medal in the women's over 57kg-60kg (lightweight) category at CWG 2022 after losing the semi-final to England's Gemma Paige Richardson. With Jaismine's bronze medal, India's medal tally at CWG 2022 has reached 30. Earlier, boxers Nitu Ghanghas, Amit Panghal and Nikhat Zareen reached the finals of their respective categories.

105.title: Supreme Court to look into changing abortion law to include unmarried women
105.article_body: The Supreme Court said it will interpret the Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act and the related rules to potentially allow unmarried women to terminate pregnancies up to 24 weeks. Asking the Centre to file a note by the next hearing on August 10, SC asked why unmarried women should be barred from ending pregnancies if married women are allowed.

106.title: Zerodha Founder gets query asking 'How to become a Co-founder at Zerodha?', shares pic
106.article_body: Nithin Kamath, the Founder and CEO of Zerodha, shared the screenshot of a query by a person. "Hi Zerodha, how to become a Co-founder at Zerodha?" the person asked. Sharing the screenshot, Kamath wrote, "The queries we get." After another Twitter user asked, "What's the answer?", Zerodha's Twitter handle responded, "Error processing request."

107.title: Players get mentally tired if they play back-to-back: Dhawan
107.article_body: Amid the ongoing debate on the decision to rest some of the senior Indian players from a few series, India batter Shikhar Dhawan said that players get mentally tired if they continue to play "back-to-back". "If you see there is rotation in international cricket so that players get rest. If a player travels everywhere, he will get tired," Dhawan said.

108.title: Bangladesh hikes fuel prices by record 50% amid rising inflation
108.article_body: Bangladesh on Friday raised fuel prices by around 50%, the highest price hike in the country's history, amid rising inflation. The fuel price increase was inevitable given global market conditions, the government said. "The new prices will not seem tolerable to everyone. But we had no other choice," Nasrul Hamid, the State Minister for Power, Energy and Mineral Resources, said.

109.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar elected 14th Vice-President of India
109.article_body: NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar has been elected as the 14th Vice-President of India after defeating Opposition's candidate Margaret Alva. Dhankhar, who has served as Governor of West Bengal in the past, is a lawyer by training and belongs to Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu. The term of office of M Venkaiah Naidu, Vice-President of India, is ending on August 10.

110.title: 2 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment over Dhanbad judge's murder
110.article_body: A special Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court in Jharkhand's Dhanbad on Saturday sentenced two convicts, including an autorickshaw driver, to rigorous life imprisonment till death in a case related to Additional Sessions Judge Uttam Anand's murder. The court had in July found the two guilty in the case, a year after Anand was mowed down during a morning jog.

111.title: BCCI ethics officer asks Nita Ambani to respond to conflict of interest allegations
111.article_body: BCCI ethics officer Vineet Saran has asked MI owner Nita Ambani to respond to conflict of interest allegations against her. Nita was served a notice after Saran received a complaint from MPCA member Sanjeev Gupta. Gupta alleged Nita has conflict of interest as she's also a director at Reliance Industries, which recently bought IPL digital rights through subsidiary Viacom 18.

112.title: KK's children recreate 'Yaaron' with Shaan, Papon ahead of Friendship Day
112.article_body: KK's children, Taamara and Nakul, have recreated the late singer's track 'Yaaron', along with Shaan, Papon, Benny Dayal, Dhvani Bhanushali and Leslee Lewis. Sharing a video from the recording, Taamara wrote they recorded the track at the Purple Haze Studios, where KK recorded this song around 24 years ago. "Wish dad was [here]," she added with the hashtag 'Friendship Day'.

113.title: At least 12 killed, 31 injured after Polish bus crashes in Croatia
113.article_body: A bus from Poland veered off a road and crashed near Varazdin in Croatia early on Saturday, killing at least 12 of its occupants and injuring 31 others on board, Croatian authorities said. "All the victims are Polish citizens," Poland's Foreign Ministry confirmed. The passengers were adult pilgrims headed to a Roman Catholic shrine in Bosnia, Croatia's Interior Minister informed.

114.title: Pics show parasite that enters fish's mouth, eats its tongue and then replaces it
114.article_body: Pictures show a parasite that enters a fish through its gills, eats its tongue and then replaces it. Cymothoa exigua, or the tongue-eating louse, belongs to the Cymothoidae (ectoparasite) family. After replacing the fish's tongue, it then feeds on the fish's mucus. The parasite was discovered among an import of fish in Suffolk, UK, in June.

115.title: Boxer Nikhat Zareen reaches final at CWG 2022, assures India of at least silver
115.article_body: India's 26-year-old boxer Nikhat Zareen has reached the final of the women's over 48kg-50kg (light fly) category, assuring India of at least a silver medal. Nikhat defeated 21-year-old Savannah Stubley of England in the semi-final bout. Earlier today, boxers Amit Panghal and Nitu Ghanghas also reached finals of their respective categories.

116.title: BSP MP cleared of rape charges 1 yr after complainant died due to self-immolation
116.article_body: A Varanasi court acquitted Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) MP Atul Rai in a rape case on Saturday. The 24-year-old complainant died last year after setting herself on fire outside Supreme Court alleging a delay in justice. Rai, who represents Uttar Pradesh's Ghosi constituency, will remain in jail as an abetment to suicide case is pending against him, his lawyer said.

117.title: Over 100 pigs die due to suspected African swine fever in Ranchi
117.article_body: The Jharkhand Animal Husbandry Department has sounded an alert after over 100 pigs died in Ranchi since July 27 due to suspected African swine fever, a government official said on Saturday. The department has asked all districts to take precautionary measures and follow COVID-19-like protocol in case of a similar occurrence. The department has also initiated swine fever vaccination drives.

118.title: Singer Armaan Malik dating lifestyle blogger Aashna Shroff: Report
118.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik is reportedly dating lifestyle blogger Aashna Shroff. "They were seeing each other in 2017 but then broke up. They then started dating again in 2019," Hindustan Times said quoting sources. The couple is currently in Denmark celebrating Shroff's birthday. They both took to their respective Instagram accounts to share a picture with British singer Ed Sheeran.

119.title: Indian women's 4x100m relay team qualifies for final at CWG 2022
119.article_body: Indian women's 4x100 metres relay team of Dutee Chand, Hima Das, Srabani Nanda and Jyothi Yarraji qualified for the final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Saturday. The Indian team finished second in heat one, clocking 44.45 seconds. Jamaica topped the heat with a timing of 43.66 seconds. The final will be held on Sunday.

120.title: Not party worker: BJP on Noida man booked for assaulting woman
120.article_body: BJP's Noida unit chief Manoj Gupta said Shrikant Tyagi, the man who was booked for threatening and abusing a woman following an argument with her in Noida, is "not a BJP worker". "He had come to the party some four-five years ago with Swami Prasad Maurya, who has now left the BJP. Tyagi was his disciple," Gupta further said.

121.title: Indian men's fours lawn bowls team win their first-ever medal at CWG
121.article_body: Indian men's fours lawn bowls team on Saturday created history by winning their first-ever medal at CWG. Sunil Bahadur, Navneet Singh, Chandan Kumar Singh and Dinesh Kumar bagged silver medal at CWG 2022 after losing the final against Northern Ireland team. Earlier, Indian women's fours lawn bowls team had won gold medal at CWG 2022.

122.title: Is this govt so aloof: Priyanka after CUET exam gets cancelled
122.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi criticised the BJP government after the CUET exam was called off due to alleged technical snags on Friday. "Technical snags have led to over 50,000 students being unable to take the CUET exam," Priyanka tweeted. "Is this government so aloof and insensitive to our students...Is this what the youth of our country deserves?" she asked.

123.title: Traffic curbs issued for Swatantra Bharatha Vajrotsavam event in Hyd
123.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police have issued traffic restrictions for the inaugural event of Swatantra Bharatha Vajrotsavam in Hyderabad. Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao will inaugurate the event at Hyderabad International Convention Centre on Monday. Citizens have been asked to avoid routes like Cyber Towers Junction and Alwyn-Kondapur road. The movement of heavy vehicles is restricted in certain areas.

124.title: Hamza is sick of reading online hate he's getting: Vijay on 'Darlings' role
124.article_body: Vijay Varma, taking to Instagram, dropped a few behind-the-scenes pictures from the sets of his recently released movie 'Darlings'. The actor, who plays the role of an abusive husband Hamza in the film, wrote, "Hamza is sick of reading all...online hate he's getting." Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Dil se hated your character...which shows how good you were."

125.title: Fireman called to burning home for rescue finds own kids killed in the fire in US
125.article_body: A firefighter in the US who went on a rescue operation to a burning home found that many of his own family members had been killed in the fire. Harold Baker said two of his children, his father-in-law, brother-in-law and sister-in-law were among those killed. "I tried to get in as fast as I can," said Baker after the tragedy.

126.title: 2018 silver medallist Sindhu reaches 3rd straight singles semis at CWG
126.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu reached her third straight semi-final at the Commonwealth Games on Saturday. The 2018 silver medallist defeated Jin Wei Goh of Malaysia 19-21, 21-14, 21-18 in the quarter-final. Sindhu will face Jia Min Yeo of Singapore in the semi-final on Sunday. Earlier at ongoing Commonwealth Games, Sindhu won a silver medal in mixed team event.

127.title: BJP is ruling Gujarat for 27 yrs, they've become arrogant: Kejriwal
127.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said BJP has become arrogant after ruling Gujarat for too long. "BJP is ruling Gujarat for 27 years, they've become arrogant. They don't have anything to do with people," Kejriwal said. "I being Delhi CM, met victims of 'Lattha' (spurious liquor) incident while (Gujarat) CM didn't," he stated.

128.title: Bengaluru civic body asks residents to exchange 'sub-standard' flags
128.article_body: After being accused of selling national flags of "sub-standard quality", the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has asked residents to get them exchanged with new ones. Notably, the BBMP had ordered 10 lakh national flags, to be sold at ₹22 each, under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. However, they were found to be violating the Flag Code of India 2002.

129.title: Connect 93 Gr Noida villages with sewage network: NGT to officials
129.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed authorities to connect 93 villages of Greater Noida with the sewage network to ensure no effluent spills into water bodies. The tribunal noted the villages were provided with internal drains but these were not joined with the main sewer line. NGT Chairperson Justice AK Goel said proper hygiene is imperative for a clean environment.

130.title: Fire breaks out in children's hospital in Mumbai, no one hurt
130.article_body: A fire broke out at Bai Jerbai Wadia Hospital for Children in Mumbai's Parel area on Friday evening. At the time, the operation theatre was closed and no injuries were reported. The fire brigade classified it as a 'level 2' fire and eight fire engines were sent to the scene to douse the blaze.

131.title: Flooding due to heavy rain in Senegal's capital kills at least 1
131.article_body: Flooding caused by torrential rain in Senegal's capital, Dakar, left at least one person dead and another severely injured on Friday, a police officer said. The city witnessed 126 mm of rainfall between 9 am and 3 pm on Friday. Videos showing flooded underpasses and water pouring through the windows of abandoned vehicles surfaced online.

132.title: India beat England to reach gold medal match of first-ever women's cricket event at CWG
132.article_body: India defeated England by four runs in the semi-final to reach the final of the first-ever women's cricket event at CWG. Batting first, India put up a total of 164/5 in their 20 overs, with Smriti Mandhana top-scoring with 61(32). England were restricted to 160/6 in their 20 overs. India will face either Australia or New Zealand in the final.

133.title: CWG 2022 gold medallist Sakshi Malik tears up during medal ceremony, video goes viral
133.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik, who bagged a gold medal in the women's freestyle 62 kg category at CWG 2022, teared up during the medal ceremony. In a video that has gone viral, Sakshi can be seen getting emotional as National Anthem is played in the background. Overall, Sakshi has won three medals in the history of CWG.

134.title: Over 13,000 Pune families to get COVID-19 relief funds
134.article_body: Pune's District Disaster Management Authority has sanctioned 13,338 applications for compensation to the families that lost members due to COVID-19. According to Pune Municipal Corporation's health department, 16,638 applications were received since December last year, which included several double entries. The state government has declared an ex-gratia of ₹50,000 for affected families.

135.title: New B'luru-Chennai e-way will reduce travel time to 2 hrs: Gadkari
135.article_body: The new expressway between Bengaluru and Chennai will reduce the travel time between the two cities to two hours, Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said. "India will have 26 new green expressways in the next three years and this will reduce the travel time for people choosing roadways," Gadkari said.

136.title: Gir calf born via embryo transplantation in Pune
136.article_body: A Gir calf was born using embryo transplantation technology at Mahatma Phule Krishi Vidyapeeth in Pune. University's Vice-Chancellor Prashantkumar Patil said this technology will help in preserving indigenous breeds of cattle, such as Gir. Embryo transplantation technology involves extracting the egg from a chosen female and fertilising it outside the female's body with sperm from a selected male.

137.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan to contest by-polls for 9 parliamentary seats
137.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan will contest by-elections for nine parliamentary seats on September 25, his party, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), announced on Friday. The seats had fallen vacant after PTI lawmakers' resignation in April amid a political crisis in the country. Khan was ousted from PM's post after losing a no-confidence vote.

138.title: BMC set to auction properties attached for non-payment of taxes
138.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is appointing an auction agency to sell land estates that were attached for non-payment of property taxes. The Mumbai civic body has attached over 2,800 properties with an estimated value of ₹3,047 crore in the last three years. The municipality said it is expecting tax defaulters to pay the dues once the auction begins.

139.title: T'gana CM to boycott Centre's NITI Aayog meet, cites 'bias against states'
139.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, in a letter to PM Narendra Modi, informed him of his decision to skip the NITI Aayog meeting on Sunday. "I'm staying away...as a part of...protest against the present trend of Central government to discriminate against states and not treating them as equal partners in our collective effort to make India a strong...country," Rao stated.

140.title: Abbott FreeStyle Libre aims to make glucose monitoring prick-free
140.article_body: Abbott announced the launch of FreeStyle Libre, a sensor-based monitoring device, aiming to help people with diabetes to track their glucose levels. The wearable product monitors glucose levels without fingerpricks & time spent in desired glucose range. It enables users to make informed decisions on lifestyle modification & dietary control while sharing real-time data with experts, said the brand.

141.title: Red alert in Hyd tomorrow, heavy rains expected until Tuesday: IMD
141.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert in Hyderabad for Sunday. "Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall is 75% to 100% likely to occur over north-east, north and adjoining districts of Telangana during 8 and 9 August," IMD added. As per IMD, the maximum temperature in the city is likely to be normal during the next week.

142.title: MP Raut's wife reaches ED office for questioning in Patra Chawl case
142.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's wife Varsha Raut reached the Enforcement Directorate's office in Mumbai on Saturday to record her statement in the Patra Chawl money laundering case. The ED had summoned Varsha for questioning after transactions done on her account came to light. Earlier, the agency attached assets worth ₹2 crore belonging to Varsha as part of its probe.

143.title: ED gets custody of jailed Gujarat-cadre IAS officer in bribery case
143.article_body: The ED on Friday got the custody of suspended Gujarat-cadre IAS officer K Rajesh who was arrested in July by the CBI for his alleged involvement in a bribery case. In its chargesheet, CBI had accused Rajesh of accepting bribes for issuing arms licences to ineligible people, among other charges. The ED also got custody of Rajesh's co-accused Rafiq Memon.

144.title: Sreeja Akula loses women's TT singles semi-final, to play for bronze at CWG 2022
144.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula on Saturday lost her women's table tennis singles semi-final at CWG 2022 against Singapore's Feng Tianwei. Akula lost the match with a scoreline of 6-11, 11-8, 11-6, 9-11, 8-11, 11-8, 10-12. Akula will now face Australia's Yangzi Liu in the bronze medal match tomorrow.

145.title: CUET UG 2022 exam postponed at 53 centres today amid reported glitches
145.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has postponed the CUET UG 2022 exam that was to be held at 53 centres across India on Saturday (August 6). This came amid reports of students facing glitches during Friday's exam. The postponed exam would be held between August 12 and 14 and the same admit card will be valid, NTA said.

146.title: North vs South debate doesn't exist for common cinemagoer: 'Laal...' writer
146.article_body: Actor and 'Laal Singh Chaddha' writer Atul Kulkarni said in an interview that the debate on Hindi vs South film industry "doesn't exist for common cinemagoer". "The common cinemagoer watches the film that he or she likes," he added. "And then they listen to their peers, relatives who've seen the film, and if...film is recommended and all that," said Atul.

147.title: 4 people's dictatorship is leaving no stone unturned in ruining India: Rahul
147.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the government by saying that the "dictatorship of four people is leaving no stone unturned in ruining the country". "Before exams, it is 'pariksha pe charcha'...during exams, it is 'no parcha, no charcha'...after exams, the future is dark," Rahul tweeted. He added that every youth's story is similar to what happened with the CUET candidates.

148.title: Ex-IAS officer cheated of ₹2 lakh while buying liquor online in Gurugram
148.article_body: A retired woman IAS officer from Gurugram was duped of nearly ₹2 lakh after she tried to order liquor online. "We've put the mobile number used in the fraud on surveillance and investigating. The accused will be nabbed at the earliest," a police official said. The website accessed by the victim was also used to cheat others, the police said.

149.title: Widespread rainfall warning issued for several states, IMD releases list
149.article_body: Widespread rainfall is very likely over Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh on August 6 and 7 and in Maharashtra between August 6-8. Rainfall is also very likely over West Bengal, Sikkim, Jharkhand, Odisha, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura. Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Telangana, Kerala, UP, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Rajasthan are also likely to receive rainfall.

150.title: Selfie craze can be deadly: IAS officer on video of elephants running towards tourists
150.article_body: Tamil Nadu IAS officer Supriya Sahu on Saturday tweeted a video of a pack of elephants charging towards some tourists who were posing for selfies some distance away from the animals. "Selfie craze with wildlife can be deadly," said Sahu, adding, "These people were simply lucky that these gentle giants chose to pardon their behaviour."

151.title: 2 delivery men arrested in Mumbai for changing new products with damaged ones
151.article_body: Charkop Police have arrested two delivery men of a Mumbai-based company for allegedly switching brand new products with damaged or duplicate ones. The accused Ashique Qureshi (47) and Rajkumar Yadav (30) used to return the products, by stating that customers were unavailable, at the company's godown after replacing them with damaged ones, police said.

152.title: Use the metro brother: Minister KTR to man over traffic in Hyderabad
152.article_body: During an online question-and-answer session conducted by Telangana's Minister for Municipal Administration and Urban Development KT Rama Rao (KTR), a Twitter user asked, "What are the plans to address the traffic jams on [Hyderabad's] Begumpet-Paradise stretch?" To this, KTR replied, "Use the metro brother." Criticising his reply, a user tweeted, "Sir food is expensive…[You] can drink water bro!"

153.title: Your feat will inspire millions: Prez Murmu on Priyanka's silver in race walk
153.article_body: After Priyanka Goswami became the first-ever Indian to win a silver medal in 10,000 metres race walk at Commonwealth Games on Saturday, President Droupadi Murmu congratulated her. "[By] becoming the first Indian woman to win a medal in race walking you have opened a new chapter of achievements. Your feat will inspire millions, especially our girls," she tweeted.

154.title: Alcoholic father beats 20-yr-old son to death in Thane; arrested
154.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly beating his 20-year-old son to death in Thane's Bhiwandi area. The accused, who is an alcoholic, started beating his wife up during a quarrel on the night of August 4. When the couple's two sons intervened, the accused attacked one of them with an iron rod and killed him, police said.

155.title: Indian wrestler Ravi Dahiya defeats Pakistan's Asad Ali, reaches gold medal bout
155.article_body: India's Olympic silver medal-winning wrestler Ravi Kumar Dahiya defeated Pakistan's Asad Ali in the men's freestyle 57 kg semi-final to assure India of another silver or gold medal at CWG 2022. Ravi won the bout in 3 minutes and 17 seconds. Earlier, India's Naveen also reached the final of men's 74 kg freestyle category.

156.title: Salon employee held for molesting 16-yr-old girl in Gurugram: Police
156.article_body: An employee in a salon in Gurugram's Sector 56 was arrested for allegedly molesting a 16-year-old girl during a head massage, the police said. The victim's parents had confronted the accused at the salon after being informed about the incident, they added. The accused confessed to the crime after the arrest and he was released on bail, they further said.

157.title: 2 African men apprehended in Delhi for allegedly making fake visas
157.article_body: Two African men were apprehended in Delhi's outer district area after they were allegedly caught making fake Indian visas during a police raid, officials informed. They were also found in possession of a laptop with blank formats of Indian visas and other suspicious files, police said. The duo allegedly admitted to making fake visas for their own passports.

158.title: Centre writes to Delhi & 6 states over rise in COVID-19 cases, list released
158.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to six states and one Union Territory over a rise in COVID-19 cases there, advising them to ramp up testing and vaccination. Delhi, Kerala, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and Telangana have received the advisory from Central Government. Delhi on Friday recorded 2,419 new COVID-19 cases, marking a six-month high.

159.title: Homeless man arrested for killing 20-yr-old aspiring singer in Versova
159.article_body: Days after a 20-year-old aspiring singer, Suraj Tiwari, was killed with a paver block at a bus stop in Mumbai's Versova, police arrested a man named Monu for the crime. According to police, Suraj and Monu, who lived on the streets of Andheri, were friends and would do drugs together. Monu killed Suraj following a fight, police added.

160.title: Govindas participating in Dahi Handi to get free insurance cover
160.article_body: While BJP announced ₹10 lakh insurance cover for Govindas participating in the Dahi Handi festival in Mumbai this year, MNS said it'll be giving insurance cover of ₹100 crore for 1000 Govindas for free. "Every year, many Govindas suffer serious injuries or lose their lives during the festival," a BJP leader said, adding that nobody pays attention to their sufferings.

161.title: Australia should be prudent on Taiwan-related issues: Chinese embassy
161.article_body: China hopes that Australia will be prudent on Taiwan-related issues and "not follow certain countries' strategy of containing China with Taiwan and...create new troubles...in China-Australia relations", the Chinese Embassy in Australia said. The comments came after US, Australia and Japan released a joint statement expressing concerns over China's recent military exercises in the Taiwan Strait.

162.title: Armaan meets Ed Sheeran, says 'Truly an emotional evening for me'
162.article_body: Singer-songwriter Armaan Malik took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with Ed Sheeran. Armaan, who had collaborated with the British singer for a song, wrote, "Truly an emotional evening for me." "From doing a song with @EdSheeran to finally meeting him [and] talking about music and life...Thank you Ed for being so warm and humble," he added.

163.title: 40-yr-old Sharath beats 16-yr-old Quek to enter men's TT singles semis at CWG
163.article_body: Indian paddler Sharath Kamal reached the men's singles semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Saturday. The 40-year-old beat 16-year-old Yong Izaac Quek of Singapore 11-6, 11-7, 11-4, 11-7 in the quarter-final. Sharath will face Paul Drinkhall of England in the semi-final on Sunday. Earlier, Sharath also reached semi-finals of mixed doubles and men's doubles in Birmingham.

164.title: Could've made comeback 2-3 weeks ago, played in T20Is vs WI: Chahar
164.article_body: India pacer Deepak Chahar, who hasn't played since February 2022 after suffering a hamstring injury, revealed that he could've made his comeback two-three weeks ago. "I could've played...T20I series against West Indies. But then, my thought process was that whenever you play, you give your 110%," he added. Chahar has been included in India's 15-member squad for upcoming Zimbabwe tour.

165.title: Villager killed by maoists on suspicion of being police informer in MP
165.article_body: Maoists allegedly killed a villager on suspicion of being a police informer in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district, police said on Saturday. The maoists reportedly took the body away with them. According to reports, a note was recovered from the spot wherein Communist Party of India (Maoist) took responsibility for the death and warned police against converting local people into informers.

166.title: India's forex reserves rise by $2.4 billion after 4-week fall
166.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves rose by nearly $2.4 billion to $573.9 billion during the week ending July 29, according to the Reserve Bank of India's weekly supplementary statistical data. The rise was led by positive inflows by foreign investors in the Indian equity market. It had been witnessing a fall for four consecutive weeks prior to that.

167.title: World's most powerful telescope spots most distant galaxy ever seen, pic released
167.article_body: University of Edinburgh scientists said they've used the world's most powerful telescope, NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, to spot the most distant galaxy ever observed by mankind. The galaxy CEERS-93316 is located 35 billion light-years away, researchers said. Last month, the galaxy GLASS-z13, located 33 billion light-years away, had broken the record of the farthest galaxy ever observed.

168.title: Don't want people to be part of my grief: Ketki on working after Rasik's death
168.article_body: Actress Ketki Dave in an interview revealed that she resumed work two days after her actor-husband Rasik Dave's death. She said that she doesn't want people to be a part of her grief. People should be included in one's happiness, Ketki added. Rasik passed away in Mumbai at the age of 65 after suffering kidney failure.

169.title: Fans of Vijay distribute free food in Coimbatore to marks 30 yrs of Ajith
169.article_body: Fans of actors Vijay and Ajith Kumar recently came together to serve free food to the poor in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore to celebrate Ajith's 30 years in the industry. As per reports, Vijay and Ajith are considered to be on-screen rivals and their fans are also known rivals. Pictures of the event celebrating Ajith went viral on social media.

170.title: 'Piku' was a beautiful collaboration with Big B, Irrfan: Deepika
170.article_body: Speaking about her 2015 film 'Piku', actress Deepika Padukone stated that it was a "beautiful collaborative process" with Amitabh Bachchan and late actor Irrfan Khan. She further said that all three of them were "really genuinely invested in telling a good story". The actress added that she is at an age where she is Piku and it's her favourite character.

171.title: Pooja Gehlot, Vinesh Phogat enter semi-finals in wrestling at CWG 2022
171.article_body: Wrestlers Pooja Gehlot and Vinesh Phogat entered the semi-finals of the 50-kg category and 53-kg category respectively, at CWG 2022. Pooja defeated Christelle Letchidjio 12-2, going on to enter the semi-finals after her opening match against Cameroon's Rebecca Ndolo was forfeited. Vinesh beat Canada's Samantha Stewart in her opening match via fall by 2-0, further defeating Mercy Adekuoroye 6-0.

172.title: Burn vehicles: K'taka MLA to people being stopped from destroying trees
172.article_body: Karnataka legislator from Janata Dal (Secular), Suresh Gowda, allegedly abused forest officers and issued threats to burn their vehicles. In a video that reportedly went viral, he can be seen abusing and threatening forest staff who restrained people from destroying trees on a forest land. "You...all set forest vehicles on fire...Rest, I will take care," the MLA reportedly said.

173.title: US dollar gains after payrolls report shows job growth in July
173.article_body: The US dollar recorded its biggest daily percentage gain since mid-June against the yen on Friday and rallied across the board. The US dollar was up 1.3% against the yen for the week. The dollar index extended gains following a US payrolls report that showed non-farm payrolls surged by 5,28,000 jobs in July, which is the largest gain since February.

174.title: US adds 5,28,000 jobs in July, unemployment rate declines to 3.5%
174.article_body: US employers hired more workers than expected in July with non-farm payrolls adding 5,28,000 jobs, the US Labor Department's report showed.
