This led the unemployment rate to decline to a pre-pandemic low of 3.5% from 3.6% in June. All the 2.20 crore jobs lost in March and April 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic in the US have reportedly been recovered.

175.title: Sable becomes first-ever Indian to win a medal in 3,000m steeplechase at CWG
175.article_body: Avinash Sable has become the first-ever Indian athlete to win a medal in 3,000m steeplechase event at CWG. The 27-year-old clocked 8:11.20, his personal best timing, to bag the silver medal in men's 3,000m steeplechase event at CWG 2022. He missed out on a gold medal by a margin of 0.05 seconds. Kenya's Abraham Kibiwot bagged gold by clocking 8:11.15.

176.title: Centre directs Maharashtra to ramp up COVID-19 testing
176.article_body: Amid surge in daily COVID-19 cases, the Centre has directed Maharashtra government to ramp up testing and vaccination drive. The state has been reporting high average daily cases for past one month (2,135 average cases/day). "State is advised to diligently follow five-fold strategy, i.e. test, track, treat, vaccinate and adherence to COVID appropriate behaviour," letter from Health Ministry read.

177.title: Locals involved in murder of BJP youth leader: K'taka Home Minister
177.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Saturday said the killers of BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru were locals and not from Kerala. He further claimed that the killers are from Dakshina Kannada district and will be arrested in two or three days. This comes after CM Basavaraj Bommai decided to hand over the case to NIA, citing an "inter-state link".

178.title: 1,400 flights cancelled as thunderstorms hit US East Coast
178.article_body: Nearly 1,400 flights in the US were cancelled and 6,300 flights were delayed on Friday after thunderstorms hit the East Coast, according to tracking service FlightAware. Most cancellations were recorded at the three major airports in the New York City area and Reagan National Airport outside Washington, DC. About 250 flights each were cancelled by American Airlines and Republic Airways.

179.title: YouTuber breaks Guinness World Record by doing 25 pull-ups hanging from a helicopter
179.article_body: The most pull-ups from a helicopter in one minute is 25, and was achieved by Stan Bruininck (Netherlands) at Hoevenen Airfield in Antwerp, Belgium, on July 6. Bruininck is a fitness enthusiast specialising in calisthenics. He is one of the presenters of the YouTube channel 'Browney'. The number to beat was 23 pull-ups, previously achieved by Roman Sahradyan (Armenia).

180.title: We only want to help: Binance CEO on his 'fight' with WazirX Co-founder on Twitter
180.article_body: Amid WazirX Co-founder Nischal Shetty and Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao's argument on Twitter over the latter owning equity in the former's cryptocurrency trading platform, a Twitter user asked Zhao why they were fighting. Zhao replied, "Not us fighting. ED investigating WazirX. We only want to help." While Shetty asserted that Binance acquired WazirX, Zhao said the transaction was never completed.

181.title: Not even Superman can fix crisis in Myanmar, says ASEAN envoy
181.article_body: Prak Sokhonn, a special envoy from the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), on Saturday said that even Superman cannot solve the crisis in Myanmar. Sokhonn has made two trips to Myanmar since the coup. "Negotiation takes years...After two visits of the special envoy, two visits only, some people start to lose patience and ask for results," he added.

182.title: 18 people including 3 kids fall ill after consuming 'prasad' in Assam
182.article_body: As many as 18 people, including three children, were hospitalised as they fell sick after consuming 'prasad' at a religious function in Assam's Majuli district. The people reportedly complained of stomach aches and vomiting right after consuming the 'prasad'. "Their health condition is now stable. We suspect...it's a case of food poisoning," a doctor from the district hospital said.

183.title: School students in Delhi, TN make rakhis for Army jawans
183.article_body: Students of various schools in Delhi and Tamil Nadu on Saturday presented self-made rakhis to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh for the soldiers protecting the borders. "As the Defence Minister of the country, I assure you that I myself will give these rakhis to the three service chiefs so that these can reach jawans of all the three services," said Singh.

184.title: I guarantee Prabhas' Project K will change Indian cinema, can't wait: Dulquer
184.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said that he guarantees that actor Prabhas' 'Project K' is going to change Indian cinema forever. "I know everybody is dying to know about 'Project K'. I had the good fortune of just peeping into the sets...I don't think anybody's thinking the way Nagi is...I can't wait. I know none of you can," he added.

185.title: Amnesty Int'l Ukraine chief quits over Russia 'propaganda' report
185.article_body: The head of Amnesty International in Ukraine resigned after the group accused Ukrainian forces of endangering civilians by basing troops in residential areas. Oksana Pokalchuk said the report "became a tool of Russian propaganda". "If you don't live in a country that's been invaded by invaders...you probably won't understand what it is like to condemn the defence army," Pokalchuk added.

186.title: IIT Guwahati completely resumes classes in offline mode
186.article_body: IIT Guwahati has resumed its classes in complete offline mode. "More than 7,400 students have attended classes in classrooms with the batch admitted during the pandemic attending full-semester classes in person for the first time," IIT Guwahati said in an official statement. It added that the institute will have over 8,700 students on campus by November 2022.

187.title: 17 lakh National Flags to be distributed in Thane
187.article_body: Under the Centre's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, 17 lakh National Flags will be distributed in Thane district of Maharashtra for hoisting ahead of India's 75th Independence Day. A total of 80,000 students have been appointed as 'Tiranga ambassadors' to spread the message. "There is a plan is to hoist 17 lakh flags [across the district]," said Collector of Thane.

188.title: I had to give Akshay an actual tight slap for a scene: Katrina on Sooryavanshi
188.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said she had to give an "actual tight slap" on Akshay Kumar's face for a scene in 'Sooryavanshi'. "I was hesitating," added Katrina. "It reminded me of the time...when Akshay and I were shooting for...'Welcome'. It was like having a deja vu," she stated. "Shooting for a Rohit Shetty film is a whole different experience," said Katrina.

189.title: Pune civic body invites project suggestions from citizens up to ₹5 lakh
189.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has started participatory budgeting (PB) and invited citizens to suggest projects of up to ₹5 lakh that can be included in the corporation's 2023-2024 budget. "This process empowers citizens to propose innovative projects and solutions for their communities and neighbourhoods," PMC said. "Since 2006-07, Pune has pioneered the process of PB in India," it added.

190.title: Ask wives how're they running kitchen: AIUDF chief to BJP MPs on inflation
190.article_body: Reacting to inflation, All India United Democratic Front chief Badruddin Ajmal criticised Finance Minister for hampering progress of the nation. He questioned Nirmala Sitharaman for her way of handling economy. "India's money is with Sitharaman...BJP MPs should ask their wives how're they running the kitchen. Centre should take note otherwise inflation will end their rule in 2024," said Ajmal.

191.title: New Parliament building likely to be ready by November: MoS Kishore
191.article_body: Union Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore informed the Lok Sabha that the new Parliament building is likely to be ready by November 2022 as its construction is 70% complete. The Vice President's enclave is expected to be ready by January 2023, he said, adding that work on the revamped Central Vista Avenue is nearly complete.

192.title: Not every story can be about a woman finding the agency: Imtiaz Ali
192.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali stated that he feels fascinated by women for having been in a more repressed and disadvantaged role than men yet having a smile on their faces. He added that his 2014 film 'Highway and web series 'She' are about women finding their agency. "[But] not every story can be about a woman finding the agency," Imtiaz said.

193.title: Lone Wolf is ready: Dhanush confirms being part of 'The Gray Man' sequel
193.article_body: Actor Dhanush took to Twitter on Saturday to confirm his return as assassin Avik San alias Lone Wolf in the Russo Brothers' directorial 'The Gray Man' sequel. He tweeted, "The Gray Man universe is expanding and the sequel is coming...Lone Wolf is ready, are you?" Netflix recently announced that the film will have a sequel as well as a spin-off.

194.title: Expedite repatriation of fishermen stranded in Oman: Stalin to EAM
194.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday wrote a letter to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar asking him to expedite the repatriation of eight fishermen from Kanniyakumari who're stranded in Oman's capital city Muscat. He said that the fishermen are stranded there due to the "expiry of their visa and non-payment of salary...by Oman national under whom they were working".

195.title: Priyanka creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win CWG silver in 10,000m race walk
195.article_body: Athlete Priyanka Goswami has created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a silver medal in 10,000m race walk at CWG. The 26-year-old clocked 43:38.83 to finish second in women's 10,000m race walk final at CWG 2022. It is India's third athletics medal at CWG 2022 after long jumper Murali Sreeshankar's silver and high jumper Tejaswin Shankar's bronze medal.

196.title: Fully cooperating with ED but don't agree with their claims: WazirX amid probe
196.article_body: WazirX on Saturday tweeted that they are fully cooperating with the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and have responded to their queries fully. However, it said, "We do not agree with the allegations in the ED press release." ED has accused WazirX of assisting Chinese instant loan app companies in laundering fraud money via the purchase and transfer of cryptocurrency.

197.title: My vision for 'Brahmāstra' began while writing 'Yeh Jawaani...' script: Ayan
197.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has stated that his vision for the upcoming film 'Brahmāstra' began in 2011 while he was working on the script of 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani' in Shimla. The filmmaker further said that he dreamt of telling a story that is rooted in Indian culture and mythology but is presented to the audience using modern technology.

198.title: Guj CM launches scheme to promote use of drones in agriculture sector
198.article_body: Gujarat government has launched Nano Urea Spraying Scheme in Isanpur Mota village of Gandhinagar district. It aims to promote the use of drones in the agriculture sector. "The use of drones in spraying the...urea will cut down the agricultural cost substantially which will increase the income of the farmers...It will also save water," said CM Bhupendra Patel.

199.title: Bengaluru Police bust fake stamp paper racket, 11 arrested
199.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested 11 people after busting a fake stamp paper racket on Friday. The accused were allegedly printing and selling the banned stamp papers on the premises of Kandaya Bhavan, police said. Fake stamp papers of various denominations worth ₹5 lakh were recovered. Notably, a head constable was sent as a decoy to bust the racket.

200.title: Delhi Directorate of Education serves termination notice to 72 teachers
200.article_body: Manish Sisodia-led Delhi Directorate of Education (DoE) has served termination notice to 72 government school teachers. This comes after it was found that there was a mismatch between the biometrics and photographs submitted by them during the 2018 Delhi Subordinate Services Selection Board (DSSSB) exam. DoE said other people had appeared in the exam in place of the actual candidates.

201.title: I bought an EV after this: Jairam Ramesh on video of exchange with Gadkari
201.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh on Saturday shared a video of a recent Rajya Sabha exchange with Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari, saying, "After this exchange...I got myself a Tata Nexon electric vehicle (EV)." Ramesh had asked Gadkari if the government had a roadmap to phase out petrol and diesel vehicles. Gadkari had talked about government's scrapping policy.

202.title: Booster dose is must for all: LNJP doctor on rising COVID cases in Delhi
202.article_body: Raising concern over the rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi, Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital MD Dr Suresh Kumar on Saturday said it's necessary for all to take the booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine. "Positivity rate has gone up along with hospitalisation," he said. "People need to be alert, especially those...who are already suffering from serious diseases," Kumar added.

203.title: Canada urges China to halt its 'coercive' military actions around Taiwan
203.article_body: Canadian Foreign Minister Affairs Mélanie Joly urged China to halt "its coercive military and economic actions" around Taiwan over US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taipei visit. "Canada is deeply concerned by the missiles launched by the People's Republic of China towards Taiwan and into Japan's exclusive economic zone," she said, adding, "This action threatens regional stability and security."

204.title: Sri Lanka's economic woes would last another year: Prez
204.article_body: Speaking at a conference, Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday said that the country's economic woes would last for another year. Sri Lanka will have to look at new sectors such as logistics and nuclear energy for its economic recovery, he added. "We have to think outside the box," Wickremesinghe further said.

205.title: Indian boxer Amit Panghal reaches final at CWG for 2nd straight time
205.article_body: Indian boxer Amit Panghal on Saturday reached the gold medal bout at CWG 2022 in Birmingham by defeating Zambian boxer Patrick Chinyemba in the semi-final of the men's over 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category. It is the second straight time that Amit has reached the final at CWG. He had bagged silver medal at CWG 2018 in Gold Coast.

206.title: Top Russian hypersonic missile scientist arrested on high treason charges
206.article_body: A prominent Russian scientist involved with the development of hypersonic missiles has been arrested on high treason charges, according to TASS news agency. Alexander Shiplyuk was detained in the Siberian city of Novosibirsk and has been taken to Moscow's Lefortovo pre-trial detention centre. He is the third Russian scientist this summer to be arrested on suspicion of treason.

207.title: Thinking about you: Marvel chief to Batgirl makers after film's cancellation
207.article_body: Marvel Studios chief Kevin Feige sent a message to directors Adil El Arbi and Bilall Fallah following the cancellation of their film 'Batgirl'. Adil, who learned about the cancellation during his wedding, shared an email from Feige, which read, "My friends, we're all thinking about you both. Because of the wonderful news about...wedding (congrats!) and the disappointing news about 'Batgirl'."

208.title: Defending champion Manika crashes out in women's TT singles quarters at CWG
208.article_body: Defending champion Manika Batra crashed out in the quarter-final of women's singles table tennis event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Friday. Singapore's Jian Zeng beat Manika 4-0. The 27-year-old lost with a scoreline of 10-12, 9-11, 4-11, 7-11. Manika also lost in the quarter-final of mixed doubles. She and her partner Sathiyan Gnanasekaran were beaten 3-2.

209.title: Google launches 'India ki Udaan' to mark 75 years of Independence
209.article_body: Google has collaborated with the Ministry of Culture to launch the 'India ki Udaan' project to commemorate 75 years of India's Independence and celebrate the milestones the country has achieved over these years. The project will use rich archives and feature artistic illustrations to tell the story of India. It also announced the Doodle4Google contest for 2022 on Friday.

210.title: 2 assaulted in Gurugram for asking neighbours to keep dog on leash
210.article_body: A 52-year-old man and his son were allegedly assaulted in Gurugram's Pataudi on July 15 for asking a neighbouring family to keep their dog on leash, police said. The duo from Baspadamka village approached the police on Thursday after recovering from their injuries, police added. They have accused their neighbours of attacking them with sharp-edged weapons, rods and bricks.

211.title: Aamir video called me, I was shocked: Naga on getting Laal Singh Chaddha role
211.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya said that he got a video call from actor Aamir Khan before he got a role in the movie 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "I was shocked because I don't get a video call from an actor like Mr Aamir Khan very often...Aamir sir...wanted me to hear the script...it went up till 1:30-2:00 am," Naga added.

212.title: Nykaa to acquire digital lifestyle platform Little Black Book
212.article_body: Nykaa's parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures will acquire a 100% stake in Iluminar Media, known as Little Black Book (LBB), a digital lifestyle discovery platform. The transaction, whose sum is yet undisclosed, is expected to be completed within 60 days of execution. "LBB's focus on fashion, home and beauty categories fits well with Nykaa’s areas of strength,” Nykaa said.

213.title: Hyderabad's Sunday-Funday festivities to restart from August 14
213.article_body: On being asked about Sunday-Funday festivities at Hyderabad's Tank Bund on Twitter, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Friday tweeted that they'll be restarted soon and tagged state special chief secretary Arvind Kumar asking him to heed the suggestion. Following this, Kumar replied saying that the festivities be restarted from August 14 onwards. Earlier, festivities were shut down amid COVID-19.

214.title: Illegal sand mining racket busted at Mutha riverbed in Pune
214.article_body: A team of Pune district officials, along with the police, busted an illegal sand mining racket at the Mutha riverbed in Shivane. They seized a JCB machine and a tractor with an attached sand mining filter net from the spot. "We suspect someone from...government team is also involved in the racket," an activist who complained about the illegal mining said.

215.title: Neeraj Chopra is my brother, I miss him here: Pak javelin thrower Arshad on CWG 2022
215.article_body: Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem said he will miss competing against Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra at CWG 2022. "Neeraj bhai is my brother. I miss him here. May God give him the best of health and I get to compete with him soon," he said. "We have a very good friendship...We are like one family," Arshad added.

216.title: Voicing opinion, protesting is 'illegal' in our country: Rahul Gandhi
216.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while reacting to FIRs filed against his party leaders for holding nationwide protests, said voicing opinions and protesting are considered "illegal" in our country. "They [BJP govt] can do whatever they want," Rahul added. Several Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Shashi Tharoor, were detained on Friday for protesting over inflation and unemployment.

217.title: 3 brothers get 10-year jail term for raping minor in UP's Sultanpur
217.article_body: A local court in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur district sentenced three brothers to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment each for raping a minor girl. The case dates back to 2010 when the then 14-year-old girl had set herself on fire after alleging being raped by the accused for a month. The accused had also reportedly threatened to push her into prostitution.

218.title: SBI's Q1 net profit falls 6.7% to ₹6,068 crore, NII rises 12.87%
218.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) reported a 6.7% year-on-year fall in net profit for the quarter ended June to ₹6,068.08 crore as against ₹6,504 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The bank's net interest income (NII) stood at ₹31,196 crore, which is a 12.87% year-on-year jump compared to ₹27,638 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

219.title: WazirX didn't cooperate with us, seems uncooperative with ED as well: Binance CEO
219.article_body: Amid a row over Indian cryptocurrency exchange WazirX's ownership, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said Binance had asked WazirX to transfer their system source code, deployment and operations in February but the latter refused to do so. "WazirX has been uncooperative with us and looks like uncooperative with ED as well," said Zhao. ED is investigating WazirX transactions worth ₹2,790 crore.

220.title: I am 'needy' and 'sensitive' just like her: Janhvi on mother Sridevi
220.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she is "needy" and "sensitive" just like her late mother and actress Sridevi. "I cry like her...I walk like her...Apparently, the sounds I make when I eat food are exactly like her...My voice is very similar to hers," added Janhvi. Janhvi had earlier stated that her life with Sridevi was a fantasy.

221.title: War in Ukraine set to enter new phase: UK military intelligence
221.article_body: The war in Ukraine is set to enter a new phase, British military intelligence said. "Russian forces are almost certainly amassing in the south of Ukraine, anticipating a counter-offensive or in preparation for a possible assault," it added. Long convoys of military trucks, tanks and towed artillery are moving southwest away from Donbas region in eastern Ukraine, it further said.

222.title: PMC to provide nutritional support to 3,000 tuberculosis patients
222.article_body: The health department of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has identified 3,000 tuberculosis (TB) patients and will provide them with nutritional support under the central government's 'End TB by 2025' campaign. A PMC TB officer said that each patient is provided at least ₹500 per month for nutrition, however, patients need flour, fruits, eggs and milk monthly which amounts to ₹1,050.

223.title: India announce their playing XI for CWG women's cricket semi-final against England
223.article_body: India captain Harmanpreet Kaur won the toss and elected to bat first against England in the women's T20I cricket semi-final at CWG 2022. India are playing an unchanged XI. India had qualified for the semi-finals after finishing second in their group. Australia will face New Zealand in the second semi-final tonight.

224.title: Noida Authority fined ₹100 cr, Delhi Jal Board ₹50 cr for polluting rivers
224.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) has fined Noida Authority ₹100 crore and Delhi Jal Board ₹50 crore for discharging untreated water into drains that eventually meet Yamuna and Ganga. The fines are an interim compensation to be utilised for restoration measures in terms of a remedial plan, NGT stated. It directed the Chief Secretaries of both states to identify erring officials.

225.title: 21-year-old Indian boxer Nitu reaches gold medal bout in her first-ever CWG
225.article_body: India's 21-year-old boxer Nitu Ghanghas has reached the gold medal bout in the women's minimumweight (45kg to 48kg) category at CWG 2022. Nitu, who is featuring in her first-ever CWG, defeated Canada's Priyanka Dhillon in the semi-final. Notably, Nitu is a two-time world youth champion in women's light flyweight (48kg) category.

226.title: Sing national anthem while holding Tiranga on August 14: Delhi CM Kejriwal
226.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has urged people to sing the national anthem while holding a Tiranga in hands at 5 pm on August 14 to celebrate 75 years of independence. AAP government has decided to distribute 25 lakh flags across the national capital. "We...must come together and pledge to make India the number one country in the world," Kejriwal said.

227.title: 23-yr-old McDonald's worker who was shot over cold french fries in US dies
227.article_body: The Brooklyn McDonald's worker shot point-blank in a spat over cold french fries has died, police said on Friday. Matthew Webb, 23, succumbed to his injuries after he was shot on Monday outside the Bedford-Stuyvesant fast food restaurant where he worked, the NYPD said. The suspect, Michael Morgan, 20, is expected to be charged with murder.

228.title: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Manmohan Singh & others cast votes for VP polls
228.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived at the Parliament on Saturday to cast his vote for the Vice-Presidential elections. Union ministers Amit Shah, Nirmala Sitharaman, Nitin Gadkari, Rajnath Singh and Dharmendra Pradhan also cast their votes. Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh arrived at the Parliament in a wheelchair to vote. Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi have also voted.

229.title: Team management was unfair, he was unnecessarily played: Hafeez on Hassan
229.article_body: Reacting to Pakistani pacer Hassan Ali not being picked for the Asia Cup 2022, ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez said Hassan was "unfairly" asked to play matches where he could've been rested. "Mentally, he wasn't ready for that pressure," added Hafeez. Hafeez stated that Hassan needs a break just like Virat Kohli who has been facing too much mental pressure.

230.title: Taiwan official leading missile production died of heart attack: Report
230.article_body: The 57-year-old Taiwanese official supervising missile production projects who was found dead at a hotel on Saturday was killed by a heart attack, local media reported quoting authorities. Ou Yang Li-hsing had a history of heart disease and had a cardiac stent, the report quoted his family as saying. His death comes amid heightened tensions with China.

231.title: Riders stuck vertically 160 ft up in air after rollercoaster malfunctions in Spain
231.article_body: At least 10 people were stuck after the rollercoaster ride they were on board suffered a malfunction, causing the riders to be trapped vertically at a height of 160 feet in a theme park in Madrid, Spain. A technical failure caused the riders to be stranded on the ride for over an hour before they were safely evacuated.

232.title: Tesla will do well even if I am kidnapped by aliens or return to my home planet: Musk
232.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk recently said, "I think Tesla...would continue to do very well even if I was kidnapped by aliens, or went back to my home planet." He was responding to a question during the company's 2022 shareholders' meeting about whether he would ever leave his role as CEO of Tesla. "I'm not leaving, to be clear," Musk clarified.

233.title: Debris from 1968 plane crash found on Swiss glacier
233.article_body: Wreckage from a plane that crashed in the Swiss Alps in 1968 has been discovered on a glacier on Thursday, police said. The debris from the plane was reportedly discovered on the Aletsch Glacier by a mountain guide during an expedition. Three people were killed on June 30, 1968, plane crash and all their bodies were discovered at that time.

234.title: If Twitter provides proof of real accounts, deal will proceed on original terms: Musk
234.article_body: Elon Musk said the $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter will "proceed on original terms", if Twitter provides its method of sampling 100 accounts and how they are confirmed to be real. "If it turns out that their SEC filings are materially false, then it shouldn't," Musk added. Currently, Twitter and Musk are involved in a legal battle over the acquisition.

235.title: Ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray returns as editor of Saamana
235.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray has returned as the editor of the party's mouthpiece Saamana after stepping down from the post of CM of Maharashtra. The print line of the Marathi newspaper published Uddhav's name as editor and party MP Sanjay Raut's name as executive editor on Friday. In 2019, Uddhav left the editor post when he became state CM.

236.title: GHMC begins appointing consultants for 4 bridges across Musi river
236.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has initiated the process of appointing consultants for constructing four bridges across Musi river. "The main objective of appointing a consulting firm was to work out...most cost-effective solution with innovative...construction technologies," a GHMC official said. The bridges will be built at Ibrahimbagh, Moosarambagh, Chaderghat and Attapur.

237.title: Khloé Kardashian welcomes second child with Tristan Thompson via surrogacy
237.article_body: American television personality Khloé Kardashian has welcomed her second child with ex-boyfriend basketball player Tristan Thompson via surrogacy. The former couple has a four-year-old daughter together named True Thompson. Khloé and Tristan started dating in 2016 and welcomed True in 2018. They split in June 2021 before reuniting and last broke up in January this year.

238.title: I am happy being single, I am lonely at times: Janhvi Kapoor
238.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor stated in an interview that she is happy being single, adding she is lonely at times. "Being lonely is a consequence of my past experiences than who I am right now," the actress added. Janhvi further stated that she is guarding herself, adding she has wasted too much of her energy on people who don't deserve it.

239.title: Instagram to test ultra-tall photos that fill entire screen soon
239.article_body: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri said the social media platform will start testing ultra-tall photos that fill entire screen "in a week or two". "You can have tall videos, but you cannot have tall photos on Instagram. So we thought...we should make sure that we treat both equally," Mosseri stated. Instagram intends to support displaying pictures in a 9:16 frame.

240.title: Mark Zuckerberg's custom-made 1992 baseball card to be sold as NFT
240.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday shared pictures of a custom-made 1992 baseball card on Instagram that'll be sold as an NFT. The card features eight-year-old Zuckerberg and lists his batting average as 0.920. He had signed the card back then and had given it to his camp counsellor, said online collectible retailer Comic Connect, which will auction the NFT.

241.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia seeks CBI probe into ex-LG's change of stance on liquor policy
241.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that he has written to the CBI seeking a probe into former Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal's change of stance on opening of liquor shops in unauthorised areas. "The cabinet's policy was earlier cleared by former LG, but the decision was later revoked. This led to losses worth thousands of crores," Sisodia claimed.

242.title: FIH apologises for clock controversy in shootout during India's women's hockey semi loss
242.article_body: International Hockey Federation (FIH) apologised for the clock controversy in shootout during India's CWG women's hockey semi-final loss against Australia. "Shootout started mistakenly too early (clock wasn't yet ready to operate), for which we apologise," it said. FIH added it'll "thoroughly review" the incident. Australia, who missed their first penalty, were asked to retake it due to the error.

243.title: Video showing bull travelling on passenger train in Jharkhand goes viral
243.article_body: A video showing a bull travelling on a passenger train going from Sahibganj in Jharkhand to Bihar has gone viral on social media. About 10-12 people boarded the bull on the train, tied it to a seat, and left, according to reports. Reacting to the video, a social media user wrote, "Incredible India."

244.title: Such bias was in cricket too: Sehwag on controversial shootout in women's hockey semi
244.article_body: Reacting to India losing to Australia in CWG women's hockey semi-final after a controversial penalty shootout, Virender Sehwag said, "Penalty miss hua Australia se and...umpire says, 'Sorry clock hasn't started'. Wah bhai wah...Hadd hai." He added, "Such bias...used to happen in cricket [too] earlier till we became...superpower...Hockey mein bhi hum jald banenge and all clocks will start on time."

245.title: With parents in jail, HC tells Delhi Police to get girl admitted to school
245.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the city police to get an eight-year-old girl admitted to a school since her parents have been in jail in connection with a murder case since 2021. The court reportedly said the child must get admitted to school at earliest so that shadow of no unpleasant happening falls upon her to darken her future.

246.title: US summons Chinese ambassador over "irresponsible" Taiwan actions
246.article_body: The US summoned China's ambassador to White House to condemn China's "irresponsible" military activities near Taiwan. "We made clear to [the envoy] that...US is prepared for what Beijing chooses to do," White House National Security spokesperson John Kirby said. China began its largest-ever military drills around Taiwan on Thursday, a day after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited the island.

247.title: Karnataka CM tests COVID-19 positive, cancels Delhi trip
247.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday tested positive for COVID-19 with mild symptoms. "Those who came in touch with me in the last few days, kindly isolate yourself and get yourself tested. My trip to Delhi stands cancelled," Bommai tweeted. He was to travel to New Delhi today to participate in the third meeting of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

248.title: Woman jumps in well with 4 kids in Raj; kids die, woman survives
248.article_body: A 32-year-old woman jumped into a well along with her four children following a family dispute in Rajasthan's Ajmer, police said on Saturday. All of the children, including the youngest who was one-month-old, died in the incident while the mother was pulled out alive, police added. No case has been filed so far, however, an investigation is underway, SHO said.

249.title: Myanmar military rulers banned from ASEAN until peace plan progress
249.article_body: Myanmar's military rulers have been barred from attending the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) meetings until they make progress on a 15-month-old plan to address the crisis triggered by the military coup. The coup prompted a mass civil disobedience movement, protests and the formation of anti-coup armed groups in Myanmar. The military has also been accused of extrajudicial killings.

250.title: 18, including children, injured as mini-bus falls into gorge in J&K
250.article_body: At least 18 people, including children, were injured when a mini-bus plunged into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district, officials said. The incident took place on Saturday morning when the bus was on its way from Barmeen to Udhampur. All injured were rushed to the hospital, officials said, adding that many of them were said to be serious.

251.title: Leave 'sarkari' attitude & perform or be ready to pack up: Vaishnaw to BSNL staff
251.article_body: In a meeting with senior management of BSNL, Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw asked employees to let go of 'sarkari' attitude and those who are not performing as per expectations, will be asked to compulsorily retire. He added, "You have to perform the best or be ready to pack up and go home...This will be the new normal- perform or perish."

252.title: Spurious liquor claims 13 lives in Bihar’s Chapra
252.article_body: At least 13 people have died after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's Chapra district (Saran) in last two days. Eleven people are currently being treated at the PMC Hospital, while 15 others who had consumed alcohol have lost their sight. Several women protested against the police on Chapra highway and demanded that the responsible officers be held accountable.

253.title: I wish I had worked on my power-hitting earlier in my career: Karthik
253.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he wishes he had worked on his power-hitting earlier in his career, adding that he has worked a lot on it. Karthik stated he's extremely happy with the backing provided by Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Team India head coach Rahul Dravid. "This is what I have aimed for all my life," he said.

254.title: He has all this money & still wears same clothes: Meta's AI chatbot on Zuckerberg
254.article_body: Meta has unveiled an AI chatbot that can search the internet to chat about any topic. After a Twitter user asked the chatbot about its feelings on Mark Zuckerberg as Facebook CEO, it replied, "He is a good businessman, but his business practices are not always ethical. It is funny...he has all this money and still wears the same clothes!"

255.title: Seer dies by suicide in Raj over land dispute, blames BJP MLA in note
255.article_body: A 60-year-old seer, identified as Ravinath, allegedly died by suicide in Rajasthan and blamed Bhinmal BJP MLA Pooraram Choudhary in a note, police said. He was found hanging from a tree at Jalore's Rajpura on Thursday night. Choudhary allegedly harassed Ravinath to give way through his hermitage to a piece of land where the MLA wanted to build a resort.

256.title: Didn't get into it for murky, dirty politics we're seeing today: Aaditya
256.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that he did not get into politics for "murky, dirty politics of treachery" that is seen today. While sharing a picture on his Instagram Stories, he wrote, "The coastal road work visit reminded me...that this is why I got into politics: sustainable development...Let them indulge in it, we will stand to serve the people."

257.title: Russia imposes entry bans on 62 Canadians in tit-for-tat move
257.article_body: Russia on Friday said it was imposing entry bans on 62 Canadian citizens including government officials. The list includes figures known for "their malicious activity in the fight against the 'Russian world' and our traditional values", the Russian Foreign Ministry said. Moscow said the bans came in retaliation for Canada's sanctions against Russian citizens in June and July.

258.title: Kohli's 57 in T20 WC 2021 loss vs Pakistan was 'impactless': Hafeez
258.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez said Virat Kohli's 57 off 49 balls in India's defeat against Pakistan by 10 wickets in T20 World Cup 2021 was "impactless". "If you can't bring an impact, there is no point of you playing," added Hafeez. "In the past two-three years, we saw...the impact wasn't there," he stated. Kohli had a strike rate of 116.32.

259.title: 1-yr-old dies as uncle takes him in lap, drops him to ground in J'khand
259.article_body: A one-year-old boy died after his paternal aunt's husband took him into his lap for playing with him but dropped him to ground with force, reports said. The boy was severely injured and was rushed to hospital but he succumbed to his injuries on Friday morning, reports added. Incident came to light when family members reached spot upon hearing screams.

260.title: Twitter fixes security bug that exposed data of anonymous account owners
260.article_body: Twitter informed that it has fixed a security vulnerability that exposed an undetermined number of owners of anonymous accounts to potential identity compromise last year. This comes after a report alleged that data of 5.4 million Twitter users were put on sale on a hacker forum. It added, while the number of users affected isn't known, no passwords were exposed.

261.title: 30-yr-old Indian-origin woman dies by suicide after 8 years of domestic abuse in US
261.article_body: A 30-year-old Indian-origin woman Mandeep Kaur, a resident of New York, died by suicide on 3 August, after repeated domestic abuse allegedly by her husband Ranjodhbeer Singh Sandhu for close to eight years. In a video, Kaur showed her bruises and blood clots and revealed how her in-laws encouraged the abuse. "I was beaten up every day," she said.

262.title: I won't be invited to his party: Kareena on ex-boyfriend Shahid Kapoor
262.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7' alongside actor Aamir Khan, said she wouldn't be invited to a party of her ex-boyfriend Shahid Kapoor. Karan Johar termed Shahid as Kareena's "ex-husband" by mistake during the episode before correcting himself. Discussing his break-up with Kareena, Shahid had earlier stated, "It was a very trying period."

263.title: 3 more die of Japanese Encephalitis in Assam, death toll reaches 60
263.article_body: After three more people died due to Japanese Encephalitis in Assam on Friday, the death toll from the disease since July 1 has reached 60, according to the state's National Health Mission. The total number of cases of the virus also rose to 345 after six more cases were reported in the state. The disease spreads through mosquito bites.

264.title: UP, Deloitte India sign MoU to meet state's $1 trillion economy target
264.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday appointed Deloitte India as a consultant to meet the target of lifting the state's economy to $1 trillion. A Memorandum of Understanding with Deloitte India was signed in Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's presence in Lucknow. By 2027, Uttar Pradesh will become a benchmark for the policy of "Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas", the CM said.

265.title: Ranveer has idiosyncrasies but translates beautifully on celluloid: Karan
265.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar on Friday penned a note for Ranveer Singh on Instagram. He wrote, "I have grown to love Ranveer Singh...He has his idiosyncrasies as an artist but [that's] what we see translate so beautifully on celluloid!" Karan further wrote, "I have been so touched on so many instances just by his generosity of spirit! I love you Ranveer!"

266.title: Our humanness is not accepted sometimes: Willow on dad Will slapping Chris
266.article_body: Speaking about her father Will Smith slapping comedian Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, singer Willow Smith said that she sees her whole family as being human. Willow further said, "Because of the position that we're in, our humanness sometimes isn't accepted and we're expected to act in a way that isn't conducive to a healthy human life and...being honest."

267.title: 50 fall ill after eating midday meal at Bihar school, students say lizard fell into it
267.article_body: Around 50 students fell ill after eating a midday meal at a government school in Bihar's Bhagalpur on Friday, an official said. The students claimed that the school's administration had served them the food even though a lizard had fallen into the vegetables while it was being cooked. Students were admitted to the primary health centre, Jagdishpur BDO said.

268.title: Uddhav was ready to align with BJP if rebels dumped Shinde: Maha MLA
268.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray was ready to align with BJP in the state if the rebel MLAs had dumped Eknath Shinde, MLA Deepak Kesarkar claimed. "This was not acceptable to the BJP or the MLAs. Because it would have been inappropriate. The rest is history," Kesarkar, who is the spokesperson of the Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction, added.

269.title: Leopard electrocuted by poachers in Madhya Pradesh, 2 detained
269.article_body: A leopard was electrocuted after it came in contact with a live-wire trap allegedly set up by poachers in Madhya Pradesh. The animal was found dead in the Beohari forest range on Friday, Divisional Forest Officer (North) Gaurav Choudhary said. "We've detained two persons in this connection," Choudhary said, adding that the animal could have been around seven years old.

270.title: Showing innocence from 20s to late 40s was very difficult: Aamir on 'Laal...'
270.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said it was "very difficult" to portray the innocence of his character in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' being 57 years old, with the character's journey from his 20s to late 40s shown in the film. Aamir added he's concerned about the film's performance, with audiences less forgiving. "Unfortunately, I have to go through this every time," he stated.

271.title: Man steals water taps, shower heads, doors from PU girls' hostel, held
271.article_body: Chandigarh Police have arrested a man for allegedly stealing hundreds of water taps, shower heads, aluminium windows and doors, reportedly estimated to be worth lakhs, from Panjab University's Girls' Hostel Number 11, last month. Three others who were involved with the arrested man have been identified and will be arrested shortly, investigators said.

272.title: K'taka govt clears investments worth ₹34,432 cr, to generate 48,850 jobs
272.article_body: Basavaraj Bommai-led Karnataka government cleared investments worth ₹34,432 crore and will create 48,850 jobs. As many as eight new projects and 10 additional investment projects were approved which are expected to generate employment opportunities, as per an official statement. Of the projects cleared, TruAlt Energy Solutions has proposed to put up an ethanol plant worth ₹1,856.47 crore.

273.title: India reports 19,406 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,34,793
273.article_body: India has reported 19,406 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,551 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,34,793, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,649, according to the latest data.

274.title: 12-yr-old Haryana boy creates 3 apps, sets Guinness record for youngest app developer
274.article_body: A 12-year-old Class 8 boy from Haryana's Jhajjar has developed three learning applications with the help of YouTube and created a Guinness World Record by becoming the youngest app developer in the world. Kartikeya Jakhar also bagged a scholarship after qualifying for the entrance exam of Harvard University. Jakhar's father had bought him a ₹10,000 phone for his online classes.

275.title: 'We could shutdown WazirX,' says Binance CEO; WazirX Co-founder replies
275.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said "we could shutdown WazirX" after he denied owning a stake in the Indian cryptocurrency exchange. Zhao, however, said they can't do that because it will hurt WazirX users. Responding to this, WazirX Co-founder Nischal Shetty said, "[This] proves you have control." Shetty reassured users that all their crypto and INR assets on WazirX are safe.

276.title: Official leading Taiwan's missile production found dead amid tensions with China
276.article_body: Amid tensions with China, an official leading the Taiwan's missile production was found dead in a hotel room, according to the official Central News Agency. Ou Yang Li-hsing was serving as deputy head of military-owned National Chung-Shan Institute of Science and Technology. The institute is working to more than double its yearly missile production capacity to around 500 this year.

277.title: IAF chief flies combat aircraft in Bengaluru
277.article_body: Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari flew indigenous Light Combat Aircraft Mk 1 'Tejas', Light Combat Helicopter and HTT-40 during his visit to Bengaluru. He was reviewing the aircraft that are being inducted into the IAF. "The Air Chief Marshal also interacted with the test crew and designers to understand the current status and future plans," IAF tweeted.

278.title: Got fooled at this age, never thought Harnaaz would do this: Upasana
278.article_body: Actress-producer Upasana Singh, who is suing Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Sandhu for breaching contract, said that she could never imagine Harnaaz would do that to her. "In this age also I got fooled by her," she added. Upasana said that Harnaaz has been avoiding her calls and friend circle, adding that she is considering a Punjabi film a small thing.

279.title: Kerala officials rescue 3 pregnant women amid heavy rainfall
279.article_body: Amid heavy rainfall in Kerala, three pregnant women who were stranded in a forest were rescued by officials and shifted to a safer place. One out of the three women gave birth to a baby girl in the forest after she refused to go to the hospital. Health Minister Veena George congratulated the rescue team for saving the women.

280.title: Cab driver plays mobile game while driving, man posts video; tags Hyd police
280.article_body: A Twitter user took to the micro-blogging site to share a video of a cab driver who was seen playing a mobile game while driving the car. "driving without seat belt and most unique way driving while playing in mobile phone...Full time he was playing," the user wrote. The man also tagged Hyderabad Police in his tweet.

281.title: Jail term certain for Sonia, Rahul in National Herald case: Swamy
281.article_body: BJP leader Subramanian Swamy said that a jail term is certain for Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and others in the National Herald case. "If BJP stays in power, they will surely be imprisoned. But in case Congress comes into power, nothing can be said," he added. Sonia and Rahul were questioned by Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with the case.

282.title: CBI summons TMC leader Anubrata in cattle smuggling case
282.article_body: The CBI on Friday summoned TMC's Birbhum district chief Anubrata Mondal in connection with the cattle smuggling case. He has been asked to appear before the investigators at 11 am on Monday. His security personnel Saigal Hussain has also been arrested by the agency. During the probe, the CBI has found huge property in the name of Hussain.

283.title: Pune man cheats investor of ₹4 cr by promising 24% returns; booked
283.article_body: Pune's Sinhgad police have booked a man for allegedly cheating an investor of over ₹4 crore by promising him 24% returns on the pretext of investing the money. The accused had floated a company which handled forex trading, share trading and construction, according to the FIR. The case was filed under IPC Section 420 (cheating) and the Information Technology Act.

284.title: Unclog jails to mark 75 years of India's Independence: SC to Centre
284.article_body: Unclogging prisons and trial courts could be a perfect way of celebrating 75 years of India's independence, Supreme Court told the central government on Friday. It urged the Centre to work with states and Union Territories to come up with measures where certain categories of undertrials and convicts could be released. "You must think out of the box," SC said.

285.title: Pelosi is the worst destroyer of international peace: North Korea
285.article_body: North Korea said US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is "the worst destroyer of international peace and stability", accusing her of inciting anti-North Korea sentiment while visiting South Korea and enraging China during her Taiwan visit this week. "It would be a fatal mistake for her to think that she can go scot-free in the Korean Peninsula," North Korea added.

286.title: 1st Muslim woman in North Kerala to get English education dies at 95
286.article_body: Maliyekkal Mariyumma, first Muslim woman in North Kerala to get English education, passed away aged 95 on Friday in Kannur district. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan expressed grief over her death. "We have lost a person who had left her indelible footprints along with the history of Thalassery....Her death plunges a generation and a region into grief," the Chief Minister said.

287.title: No sympathy for madrasas' bad elements, govt should shoot them: AIUDF chief
287.article_body: The All India United Democratic Front chief Maulana Badruddin Ajmal said that the party has no sympathy for the "bad elements" in madrasas. "Government should shoot them wherever they find them. If one or two bad teachers are found at madrasas, the government should impose detentions and pick them up once inquiry completes and do whatever they want," he added.

288.title: Man arrested for illegal possession of firearm, bullets in Hyderabad
288.article_body: The Hyderabad police on Friday arrested a 43-year-old man for illegally possessing a country-made firearm. Police also recovered eight live rounds from the accused, identified as Rakesh Tyagi. According to police, Tyagi works at a private diagnostic centre and is a native of Madhya Pradesh. He was arrested while trying to sell the firearm to prospective buyers, police added.

289.title: Actress Anne Heche critical after crashing car into house in Los Angeles
289.article_body: American actress Anne Heche is critical after crashing her car into a house in Los Angeles. The impact left the car and the house engulfed in flames, police said. "Fifty-nine firefighters took 65 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish the stubborn flames within the heavily damaged structure," Los Angeles Fire Department said.

290.title: Sick mind: Jairam on Shah linking Congress' protest to Ram Mandir
290.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Friday reacted to Union Home Minister Amit Shah linking the party's protest to Ram Mandir's foundation day, saying, "It's only a sick mind which can produce such bogus arguments." Shah had claimed that Congress choosing to protest wearing black clothes on anniversary of Ram Mandir's foundation day was a "subtle message to...promote their appeasement politics".

291.title: I was drug tested by US govt for a year: Musk on smoking weed with Joe Rogan
291.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in a podcast interview said he was drug tested by the US government after he smoked weed on Joe Rogan's podcast in 2018. "The consequences for me and for SpaceX were actually not good...I had...to prove that I'm not...a drug addict," Musk said. He added that he was randomly drug tested for everything for a year.

292.title: Hat-trick at CWG proves Bajrang has champion's consistency: Anurag Thakur
292.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted that wrestler Bajrang Punia has shown he has a "champion's consistency" after winning a third consecutive medal at CWG. Bajrang won his second consecutive gold medal at CWG, after beating Canada's Lachlan McNeil in the final of the men's freestyle 65 kg category at CWG 2022. Bajrang had won a silver medal at CWG 2014.

293.title: 27 get life sentence in 2018 Dalit triple murder case in Tamil Nadu's Kachanatham
293.article_body: A court on Friday sentenced 27 persons to life imprisonment in the 2018 triple murder of Dalit men in Kachanatham village in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga. The victims were hacked to death in a feud related to paying respects at a temple festival. Notably, five more Dalit people had sustained injuries, of which one died one and half years later.

294.title: Greek intelligence chief resigns amid wiretapping allegations
294.article_body: The head of Greece's intelligence service has resigned amid allegations that a journalist and an opposition politician had their mobile phones targeted by spying software. Panagiotis Kontoleon submitted his resignation "following mistaken actions found during lawful wiretapping procedures", PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis' office said. Secretary-General of the PM's office, Grigoris Dimitriadis, also quit.

295.title: Wasn't bothered even when 0-4 down in final: Sakshi after CWG gold medal
295.article_body: Wrestler Sakshi Malik said she wasn't bothered when 0-4 down in the women's freestyle 62 kg final against Canada's Ana Godinez at CWG 2022. Sakshi made a comeback to win her first CWG gold medal. "I'd won bouts with seconds left," added Sakshi. Discussing her double leg move in the final, Sakshi stated, "I can do [it] in my sleep."

296.title: I was clean-shaven in 2 films, both films were shaved too: Anil Kapoor
296.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor recently appeared on the OTT show 'Case Toh Banta Hai'. He was asked by actor Ritesh Deshmukh why he didn't keep his moustache after 1991 film 'Lamhe'. Anil said, "Do film mein mooche safa ki thi, unfortunately film bhi safa ho gayi yaar (I was clean-shaven in two films, unfortunately both films got shaved off too)."

297.title: Voting to elect the Vice-President of India begins
297.article_body: The voting for the Vice-Presidential election began on Saturday. For the 16th Vice-Presidential election, the Electoral College consists of 233 elected members of Rajya Sabha, 12 nominated members of Rajya Sabha, and 543 elected members of Lok Sabha. NDA has nominated Jagdeep Dhankhar as their candidate, while the Opposition fielded Margaret Alva as their candidate for the post.

298.title: China simulating attack on our main island: Taiwan
298.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry has said that multiple batches of Chinese planes and ships were spotted crossing median line of Taiwan Strait. "They were judged to be conducting a simulation of an attack on Taiwan's main island," the ministry added. This comes amid heightened tensions between China and Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan.

299.title: Paytm Q1 net loss widens to ₹644 crore, revenue jumps 89%
299.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications on Friday said that its consolidated loss widened to ₹644.4 crore in the quarter ended June 30 as against a net loss of ₹380.2 crore in the corresponding period last year. Its consolidated revenue from operations increased 89% to ₹1,680 crore year-on-year from ₹891 crore. Paytm's shares closed 3.06% lower at ₹784.30 on Friday.

300.title: Instead of GDP, govt bothered about DP: TMC MP Mahua Moitra
300.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Friday said the central government has an "uncanny knack" of ignoring what's important and concentrating on headlines. "For example...when we should be looking at...GDP (Gross Domestic Product), we're being exhorted...to concentrate on our DPs (display pictures)," she added. This comes after PM Modi urged people to put Tricolour as their display picture on social media.

301.title: Nykaa Q1 profit rises by 42% to ₹5 crore, revenue jumps 41%
301.article_body: Nykaa parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures on Friday posted a 42.24% rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹5.01 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹3.52 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue from operations grew 40.56% to ₹1,148.4 crore year-on-year. Nykaa's shares on Friday closed at ₹1,411.25 after dropping 2.30%.

302.title: Woman helps nab man who snatched her gold chain: Rachakonda Police
302.article_body: Rachakonda Police has tweeted that a woman helped catch a man who tried to escape after snatching her gold chain in Hayathnagar. The accused allegedly entered the house where woman was staying by posing as a prospective tenant, threw chilli powder at her and snatched her chain. The woman held on to accused and raised an alarm, an official said.

303.title: Uttar Pradesh announces 48 hours of free bus rides for women on Raksha Bandhan
303.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced free bus rides for women for 48 hours, starting from August 10 midnight till August 12 midnight. "On the occasion of Raksha Bandhan, the Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation will provide free travel facility in buses for the safe travel of all the women," CM Yogi's office tweeted.

304.title: Delhi people to be rewarded for detecting dummy IEDs in mock drills: Report
304.article_body: The Delhi Police has decided to reward people who detect dummy Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) placed during mock security drills, reports said. Reports added that the decision was taken after Delhi Police Special Cell "infiltrated and planted" 30 dummy IEDs in places with high footfall. Of the total, 12 were detected by the public, private security guards and local police.

305.title: Musk invents representations we never made: Twitter on merger deal
305.article_body: Responding to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's counterclaims about their deal, Twitter in a 127-page document stated that Musk "invents representations Twitter never made". It added, "Musk asserts...his own analysis…[indicating] that false or spam accounts constitute at least 10% of Twitter's monetisable daily active users…He is not measuring the same thing as Twitter or even using the same data as Twitter."

306.title: BJP leader abuses, pushes woman at Noida society; video of the incident surfaces
306.article_body: Shrikant Tyagi, who identifies himself on social media as a national executive member of BJP's Kisan Morcha, has been booked for threatening and abusing a woman after a spat with her inside a housing society in Noida. The woman objected to plantation of some trees by Tyagi. In a video of the incident, Tyagi can be seen pushing the woman.

307.title: I was bullied for weight gain, broke down many times: Harnaaz Sandhu
307.article_body: Harnaaz Sandhu, who was crowned Miss Universe 2021, revealed that she was bullied for gaining weight and broke down multiple times. She said that she worked out constantly during the pageant and had a month to relax afterward. "During that time, I...didn't work out...I was just eating and...enjoying...time with...family. I never realised...it would start showing on my body," Harnaaz added.

308.title: Mumbai maid looks for missing girl online, reunites her with mom after 9 yrs
308.article_body: A domestic help, Pramila Devendra, reunited 16-year-old girl, Pooja, with her mother in Mumbai, nine years after she was kidnapped in 2013. Devendra searched Pooja's name on Google after she told her people she lives with are not her real parents. Devendra found some missing reports with numbers, following which Pooja was able to talk to her mother over call.

309.title: Punishes the world: US on China suspending bilateral climate talks
309.article_body: US Special Envoy on Climate Change John Kerry said that China's decision to suspend bilateral talks on climate change with the US "doesn't punish" Washington, "it punishes the world". "No country should withhold progress on existential transnational issues because of bilateral differences," Kerry added. China suspended the bilateral talks after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan.

310.title: Wrote script in 14 days but Aamir didn't read it for 2 yrs: 'Laal...' writer
310.article_body: Actor and 'Laal Singh Chaddha' writer Atul Kulkarni said actor Aamir Khan did not read his script for two years, having written it in 14 days. "Aamir said, 'You are not a writer...and I don't want to disappoint you by saying you have written very badly'," added Atul. "That is why he wasn't listening to the script," he stated.

311.title: BBMP ward reservation list in favour of BJP MLAs, MPs: Congress
311.article_body: Congress on Friday criticised the BJP-led government in Karnataka for alleged "discrimination" in the reservation of 243 wards for the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) elections. The party accused BJP of splitting wards in Congress-held constituencies and giving reservations for political advantage. "[BJP] threw social justice to...wind," Congress leader DK Shivakumar said.

312.title: 4 men posing as 'police mitra' rob milk seller of cash in Pune, held
312.article_body: Pune City Police arrested four men for allegedly robbing a 24-year-old milk seller of ₹5,500 in cash after posing as 'police mitra' (friends of police) and threatening to implicate him in a false rape case. The victim had stopped his two-wheeler on the road to receive a phone call when the accused came and snatched his phone, police said.

313.title: Relocate or we'll demolish: BMC in notice regarding 114-yr-old Holy Cross
313.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has issued a public notice regarding a 114-year-old "Holy Cross" near Mumbai's Mahim Creek. In a notice that was sent out on August 1, as per reports, BMC has told the public to relocate the cross in seven days or else it would be demolished by the civic body.

314.title: Bengaluru's CBD, Manyata Tech Park areas to face power cuts today
314.article_body: Central Business District (CBD) and Manyata Tech Park areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts today amid maintenance work by BESCOM. The CBD areas, like Church Street, Residency Road, etc, will see power outages from 10 am to 6 pm. Areas under Manyata Tech Park, like Mariyanapalya, Fathima Layout, etc, will face power cuts from 10 am to 5.30 pm.

315.title: WazirX Co-founder and Binance CEO argue on Twitter over WazirX's ownership
315.article_body: WazirX Co-founder Nischal Shetty responded after Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao tweeted that Binance has never owned shares in Zanmai Labs, the entity operating WazirX. "WazirX was acquired by Binance," Shetty tweeted, adding that Binance has all the crypto assets and profits. Denying Shetty's claims, Zhao said Binance doesn't have control on WazirX's operations, but that WazirX's founding team does.

316.title: PM Modi motivated me when I didn't win medal in Tokyo: Deepak Punia
316.article_body: Following his gold medal in the men's freestyle 86 kg category at CWG 2022, Indian wrestler Deepak Punia said, "PM Narendra Modi motivated me when I didn't get a medal in Tokyo Olympics." "I was...nervous because on August 5, 2021, I lost the bronze medal in the Tokyo Olympics and I was playing on the same date," added Deepak.

317.title: Canada to temporarily ban handgun imports
317.article_body: The Canadian government said it'd temporarily ban imports of handguns from August 19. The ban will last until the national freeze on handguns comes into force, it added. The government had proposed the gun control legislation that put a freeze on importing, buying, or selling handguns in Canada in May. The Canadian Parliament is currently on summer break until September.

318.title: Parts of Chennai to face power cut from 9 am to 2 pm today
318.article_body: Chennai's Anna Salai, Perambur, Ponneri, Tambaram and IT Corridor areas will face a power cut today due to maintenance work, Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation said. The power supply in four areas will remain suspended from 9 am to 2 pm, it added. The supply is expected to resume by 2 pm if the work is completed.

319.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India jump 2 spots?
319.article_body: India clinched a total of six medals on Day 8 of CWG 2022, including three gold, one silver and two bronze medals. With this, India jumped two spots on the medal standings and are currently on the fifth position. Australia, who have bagged 50 gold medals, are leading the medal standings. Meanwhile, England are second with 47 gold medals.

320.title: Was told 'You're not SRK', now SRK took me in his film: Vijay Varma
320.article_body: Speaking about his struggle days, actor Vijay Varma has revealed that he was told 'Tu Shah Rukh Khan nahi hai (You are not Shah Rukh Khan).' "But now Shah Rukh Khan has employed me for his film," he added. Vijay further said that he figured "even beggars can be choosers" and would refuse to audition for parts he didn't like.

321.title: 23-yr-old man stabbed to death in broad daylight in Pune; 5 held
321.article_body: Five people were arrested after a 23-year-old was stabbed to death in broad daylight in Pune's Kondhwa. The deceased's sister claimed in her complaint that her brother and his friend's vehicle had met with an accident with one of the accused's car on August 1, following which the latter had threatened to murder him. The incident took place on Wednesday.

322.title: Hima Das misses out on CWG final spot by 0.01 seconds after photo finish semi-final
322.article_body: India's 22-year-old sprinter Hima Das missed out on a CWG 2022 final spot in the women’s 200m race after a photo finish semi-final 2. Hima clocked 23.42 seconds, 0.01 seconds less than second-placed Australia's Ella Connolly, who secured automatic qualification to the final along with first-placed Namibia's Christine Mboma from semi-final 2. Hima finished 10th across the three semi-finals.

323.title: India lose to Australia in women's hockey semi-final after controversial penalty shootout
323.article_body: India lost to Australia in penalty shootout in women's hockey semi-finals at CWG 2022. Controversy marred the shootout as the first penalty was ordered to be retaken by officials due to a shot-clock error. Indian goalkeeper Savita Punia had already made a save off the first attempt by Australia. Australia then converted their first three penalties, while India missed all.

324.title: Several women accuse Apple of mishandling sexual harassment complaints: Report
324.article_body: Over a dozen women reportedly accused Apple of mishandling sexual harassment complaints they had raised while working for the company. As per a Financial Times report, 15 current and former employees reported either being retaliated against or getting disappointed by the company. Meanwhile, Apple said it works hard to investigate misconduct complaints and will "make changes to its training".

325.title: Bengaluru reports 1,309 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
325.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,309 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Friday, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath. The city also recorded one death due to COVID-19, taking the number of total deaths to 16,977. With 8,338 active COVID-19 cases, the positivity rate for last seven days in Bengaluru now stands at 7.61%, data showed.

326.title: Top French scientist posts pic of sausage claiming it's a distant star; apologises later
326.article_body: Top French scientist Étienne Klein has apologised after tweeting a photo of a Spanish sausage, claiming it was an image of a distant star taken by the James Webb Space Telescope. "I feel obliged to specify that this tweet...was a joke," he wrote. Klein said his intention was "to urge caution regarding images that seem to speak for themselves".

327.title: Man caught making video of woman in shower found dead in Noida, 2 held
327.article_body: A 21-year-old man, who was caught making a video of a 19-year-old woman while she was taking a shower, was found dead in Illahabas village in Noida, police said. He was allegedly thrashed by her father and locked in a room after she raised an alarm, police added. Two men were arrested for alleged abetment of suicide, police stated.

328.title: Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson break up after dating for 9 months: Reports
328.article_body: Kim Kardashian and comedian Pete Davidson have broken up after dating for nine months, reports said. Kim and Pete have "a lot of love and respect for each other", but their schedules "made it really difficult to maintain a relationship", E! News quoted a source as saying. The pair had started dating after Kim's appearance on the 'Saturday Night Live'.

329.title: Thums Up celebrates World Boxing champion Nikhat Zareen
329.article_body: India's boxer Nikhat Zareen reached semi-finals, assuring a medal at Commonwealth Games 2022. On 75 years of India's Independence, Thums Up salutes hands that built India through its #HarHaathToofan campaign. Watch 'Toofani' story of a girl from Nizamabad who lost Olympic tryouts but kept fighting, making India proud by winning World Championship, and has become national treasure, Thums Up said.

330.title: Tool that Musk used to calculate bots on Twitter thought he was a bot, claims Twitter
330.article_body: Twitter has claimed the tool Elon Musk used to calculate the number of bots on Twitter had designated Musk himself as "highly likely" to be a bot. This comes after Musk claimed 10% of accounts on Twitter are bots. Musk cited the number of bots on Twitter as his primary reason for trying to pull out of the $44-billion deal.

331.title: Class 11 student from Gurugram develops financial literacy app 'DhanDanaDan'
331.article_body: Aryan Jain, a Class 11 Gurugram student, has developed a financial literacy app named 'DhanDanaDan' that aims to empower people to manage their finances. The app explains financial planning concepts in a simplified manner in Hindi through animated videos. In 2021, Aryan was the only Indian among the winners of NASA's Artemis Next Gen STEM-Moon to Mars App Development Challenge.

332.title: 22-year-old Mohit Grewal wins India's 6th wrestling medal of the day at CWG 2022
332.article_body: India's 22-year-old wrestler Mohit Grewal won bronze medal in the men's freestyle 125 kg category at CWG 2022. Grewal defeated Jamaica's Aaron Johnson by fall in the bronze medal bout. It was India's sixth wrestling medal on Day 8 of CWG 2022. India have now won 26 medals at CWG 2022, including nine gold, eight silver and nine bronze medals.

333.title: Indian wrestler Divya Kakran wins bout in 26 seconds, bags bronze at CWG 2022
333.article_body: Indian wrestler Divya Kakran on Friday bagged her second consecutive bronze medal at CWG. The 24-year-old won her women's freestyle 68 kg bronze medal bout at CWG 2022 in just 26 seconds, defeating Tiger Lily Cocker Lemalie by fall. India have now won a total of 25 medals at CWG 2022.

334.title: Barcelona fans chant 'Messi, Messi' during Lewandowski's official unveiling
334.article_body: Spanish club Barcelona FC's fans chanted "Messi, Messi" outside the Camp Nou stadium during the official unveiling of the club's latest signing Robert Lewandowski on Friday. Former Barcelona skipper Lionel Messi officially ended his 17-year-long association with the Spanish club on August 5 last year due to monetary issues. Notably, Lewandowski has been signed by Barcelona for €45 million.

335.title: Sikh, Muslim, Dalit outfits to take out march in Jalandhar on eve of I-Day
335.article_body: Sikh, Muslim and Dalit groups will jointly hold a conference on the eve of Independence Day and take out a march in Jalandhar to protest against the "pseudo-nationalism being imposed on Punjab by the Central Government". The activists announced to devise a common strategy to challenge the onslaughts of the "Hindutva government at the Centre" against the minorities.

336.title: Deepak Punia defeats Pakistan's Inam to win India's 3rd gold medal of the day at CWG 2022
336.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Punia defeated Pakistan's Muhammad Inam to bag a gold medal in the men's freestyle 86 kg category at CWG 2022. Deepak won the gold medal in his first-ever CWG. India have bagged three gold medals in wrestling at CWG 2022 today. Overall, India have bagged nine gold medals at CWG 2022.

337.title: Aug 5 to be celebrated as 'Bhrashtachar Mukti Diwas' in J&K: LG
337.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Friday said that August 5 will be celebrated as 'Bhrashtachar Mukti Diwas' (corruption-free day). August 5 is the anniversary of the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir. Sinha made the announcement while launching initiatives for the tribal community. "We're working...to make the development process holistic [and] universal," he said.

338.title: Congress MLA sends Tricolour to Bhagwat, asks him to hoist it at RSS office
338.article_body: Congress MLA and Chhattisgarh Pradesh Congress Committee President Mohan Markam on Friday sent the Tricolour to Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat via courier. Markam requested Bhagwat to hoist the national flag at RSS' headquarters in Nagpur. He claimed the Tricolour hasn't been hoisted at the RSS headquarters in the last 52 years, a statement released by Congress said.

339.title: Nepali minister to visit China from Aug 9 for bilateral talks
339.article_body: Nepali Foreign Minister Narayan Khadka will be on a three-day visit to China starting August 9 to strengthen bilateral ties, officials said. It'll be Nepal's first high-level official visit to Beijing since the formation of PM Sher Bahadur Deuba's government last year. The visit comes as Beijing has stepped up Belt and Road Initiative projects in the region.

340.title: Many hurt as SUV drives through US Native American heritage parade
340.article_body: An SUV drove through a parade celebrating Native American heritage in New Mexico, US, causing injuries to several people, officials said. No casualties were reported, officials said, but Navajo Nation President Jonathan Nez was among the ones who came close to being hit by the car. The driver was taken into police custody and an investigation is on.

341.title: Shelling hits power line at Ukrainian nuclear power plant
341.article_body: A high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station, captured by Russian forces, was hit by shelling on Friday, Ukraine confirmed. Ukrainian authorities said that the plant still worked after the strike and no radioactive leak was detected. So far, Ukraine and Russia have blamed each other for the shelling.

342.title: Assailants open fire at RTI activist in Gujarat; shot in head
342.article_body: An RTI activist was seriously injured after a few unknown assailants opened fire and shot at his head in Ankleshwar in Gujarat's Bharuch. The victim, Sadakat Wadiwala (40), is in critical condition as doctors haven't been able to remove the bullet, his wife Afsana said. Notably, the police have booked three suspects and the builders of Ankleshwar's Al Noor complex.

343.title: Pak's Finance Minister warns of 'bad days' amid rising inflation
343.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Miftah Ismail on Friday warned of "bad days" ahead for the country amid depleting foreign reserves. Ismail said that the country would continue to curb imports for the next three months. Last week, New York-based rating agency S&P Global revised Pakistan's long-term ratings from 'stable' to 'negative' due to rising inflation and tighter global financial conditions.

344.title: Your gold medals reflect urge to be the best: Prez Murmu on Punia's CWG gold
344.article_body: Congratulating India's wrestler Bajrang Punia following his gold medal win at the Commonwealth Games 2022, President Droupadi Murmu tweeted, "Your consistency, dedication and excellence are inspirational for our youth." She added, "Your gold medals reflect the urge to be the best, the spirit of the new India." Bajrang won his second straight gold at Commonwealth Games on Friday.

345.title: Felt as close to an international game: Morgan after 47(29) in Hundred game
345.article_body: Former English skipper Eoin Morgan returned to action on Thursday for the first time after retiring from international cricket. "Felt as close to an international game as I have ever felt in the domestic arena, anywhere else apart from India," Morgan said after scoring 47(29) in a Hundred game. He added, "India has the IPL and you have the tension."

346.title: Indian duo of Sathiyan-Sharath reaches table tennis men's doubles CWG semis
346.article_body: Indian pair of Sathiyan Gnanasekaran and Sharath Kamal defeated England's Tom Jarvis and Sam Walker 3-0 to enter the men's doubles semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022. They won with a scoreline of 11-6, 11-8, 11-4 in quarter-final on Friday. The Indian duo will play their semi-final on Saturday. Other Indian pair, Harmeet Desai and Sanil Shetty lost in quarter-final.

347.title: Spain reports first acute hepatitis deaths in children
347.article_body: Spain has recorded its first two deaths from acute hepatitis or liver inflammation among children.
