The Spanish Health Ministry said the country reported 46 cases of hepatitis, and among them, three required liver transplants. The cause of hepatitis is not yet known and some experts speculate it could be caused by a stomach bug.

348.title: Man says 'What could be quieter than a theatre during your movie', Swara responds
348.article_body: Swara Bhasker responded to a man who trolled her over her upcoming film. The man said he's "waiting eagerly for the movie" and added, "Construction work going on...not able to...sleep, what could be quieter than...theatre during your movie!" "Glad...to have given you...chance to land your much practiced and rehearsed joke...Now go show off to...your boys that I replied!" said Swara.

349.title: India responds as Islamic nations' group seeks restoration of J&K's special status
349.article_body: India on Friday criticised the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) over its remarks on the three-year anniversary of the revocation of Article 370 on Friday. OIC's statement "reeks of bigotry", External Affairs Ministry said, adding that it exposes it "as an organisation devoted to a communal agenda being pursued through terrorism". OIC had sought restoration of J&K's special status.

350.title: Conor McGregor to make acting debut in Gyllenhaal's 'Road House': Reports
350.article_body: Irish MMA fighter Conor McGregor has reportedly teamed up with Jake Gyllenhaal for a remake of 1989 cult classic 'Road House'. The film will be directed by Doug Liman, the filmmaker behind films like 'Mr. & Mrs. Smith', 'The Bourne Identity' and 'Edge of Tomorrow', among others. The original film, directed by Rowdy Herrington, featured Patrick Swayze and Sam Elliott.

351.title: Janhvi is so sweet that you cannot hold a grudge against her: Co-star Jaswant
351.article_body: Actor Jaswant Singh Dalal in an interview praised his 'Good Luck Jerry' co-star Janhvi Kapoor, saying that she's an honest actor who knows where she wants to head with her craft. Calling her "very humble and down-to-earth", Jaswant said, "She is so sweet that you cannot hold a grudge against her, you will end up smiling."

352.title: War in Ukraine will cause 40 mn to become food insecure, says US
352.article_body: Russia's invasion of Ukraine will cause 40 million people to become food insecure, US Ambassador to the United Nations Linda Thomas-Greenfield said on Friday. Sub-Saharan Africa will be hardest hit by it, she added. Notably, African countries have largely avoided taking sides in the European conflict and have refused to join Western condemnation and sanctions.

353.title: ASEAN demands cessation of violence in Myanmar
353.article_body: The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in a joint statement criticised Myanmar for lack of progress in ending violence in the country. The Myanmar military seized power from elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi in February 2021 and is accused of thousands of extrajudicial killings. ASEAN called for dialogue among all parties in Myanmar and the cessation of violence.

354.title: Biryani party was held to celebrate murder of pharmacist who supported Nupur: NIA
354.article_body: A 'biryani party' was held to celebrate the murder of Maharashtra pharmacist Umesh Kolhe, who was killed in June allegedly for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, the NIA has said. Two of those accused of Kolhe's murder had attended the alleged 'party', the agency told a court on Friday. The duo was arrested from Amravati on Wednesday.

355.title: Rishi Sunak wins TV debate against Liz Truss in race to be next UK PM
355.article_body: UK's ex-Finance Minister Rishi Sunak won a TV debate against Foreign Secretary Liz Truss in the leadership contest to elect the new Conservative Party leader and the British PM. The winner of the debate was decided by an audience made up of Conservative Party members. Notably, Sunak needs to win in Conservative Party members' postal ballot to become the PM.

356.title: Binance doesn't own WazirX: Zhao after ED freezes WazirX's bank assets worth ₹65 cr
356.article_body: Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of US-based crypto exchange Binance, said the company doesn't own Indian crypto exchange WazirX, a deal that was understood to be completed back in 2019. "Binance only provides wallet services for WazirX as a tech solution," Zhao wrote. This comes hours after ED said it has frozen bank assets of WazirX worth ₹64.67 crore.

357.title: Indian pair of Sreeja-Sharath enters table tennis mixed doubles semis at CWG
357.article_body: Sreeja Akula and Sharath Kamal reached the mixed doubles semi-final after beating England's Liam Pitchford and Tin-Tin Ho 3-2 at the Commonwealth Games 2022. The Indian duo won with a scoreline of 11-7, 8-11, 11-8, 11-13, 11-9 in the quarter-final on Friday. Sreeja and Sharath will face Australia's Nicholas Lum and Minhyung Jee in the semi-final on Saturday.

358.title: Arpita Mukherjee faces life threat, test her food in jail: ED lawyer
358.article_body: Arpita Mukherjee's advocate pleaded before a court that the aide of ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee should get Division 1 prisoner category as she faces a life threat. Agreeing with this, Enforcement Directorate's advocate said Mukherjee shouldn't be kept with more than four prisoners. The advocate said that food and water should be tested before being served to her in jail.

359.title: Talks on all-party govt moving positively: Lankan Opposition party
359.article_body: Sri Lanka's main Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya on Friday said talks on forming an all-party government were moving positively, with all lawmakers uniting to bring the country out of its economic crisis. President Ranil Wickremesinghe had earlier called for forming an all-party government. Sri Lanka, which declared bankruptcy, has failed to make international debt repayments.

360.title: Wrestler Sakshi Malik wins her 1st CWG gold medal, India's 8th at CWG 2022
360.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik won her first CWG gold medal after defeating Ana Godinez Gonzalez of Canada in the women's freestyle 62 kg final at CWG 2022. Overall, it is her third medal in CWG history after her silver at CWG 2014 and bronze at CWG 2018. India have now bagged eight gold medals at CWG 2022 so far.

361.title: He hates music during training, yells at me if I play: CWG medallist Sreeshankar's father
361.article_body: Murali, the father of Murali Sreeshankar who became the first-ever Indian male long jumper to win silver at CWG, said his son doesn't like any kind of music during training. "If I reach out my phone to play something during training he'll yell at me," he said. "He never shies away from hard work. He never finds excuses," he added.

362.title: Uproot inferiority complex to achieve true independence: Amit Shah
362.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said Indians must uproot the 'inferiority complex' within themselves to achieve 'true independence'. Speaking ahead of India's 76th Independence Day celebrations, Shah said foreign powers ruled India as they succeeded in making native citizens believe they were inferior. "The country that gave Geeta and the Vedas...how can it be illiterate," he asked.

363.title: France going through its most severe drought ever, says PM Borne
363.article_body: France is facing the "most severe drought" ever recorded in the country, French Prime Minister Élisabeth Borne warned in a statement on Friday. Many areas in France are going through a "historic situation" as the country endures its third heatwave this summer, she said. Borne announced the activation of a government crisis unit due to the situation.

364.title: Congress workers and police clash outside Raj Bhawan in Ranchi
364.article_body: A clash broke out between Congress workers and police personnel in Ranchi as several party workers forced their way to Raj Bhawan during their protest march against inflation on Friday. "The Congress workers had permission only to march till Zakir Hussain Park," an official said. "But they pulled down the barricades and reached Raj Bhawan gates," he added.

365.title: Chandigarh Police arrests gangster absconding for last 3 years
365.article_body: Chandigarh Police has arrested an absconding gangster wanted for murder and other cases by the Haryana and UP Police. The accused, Vinit Gahlot, alias Vicky Mitrau, had been absconding for the past three years, police said. Gahlot belongs to the Manjeet Mahal gang and his elder brother Ashok is also a gangster and is presently lodged in jail, police added.

366.title: Snickers maker apologises to China for ad suggesting Taiwan is a country
366.article_body: Mars Wrigley, makers of the Snickers candy bar, apologised for a Snickers product launch which allegedly called Taiwan a country. Videos and pictures of an event promoting a Snickers bar that was said to be only available in the countries of South Korea, Malaysia and Taiwan went viral. Mars Wrigley later said the relevant content had been amended.

367.title: 88% dip in law & order incidents in Kashmir since Aug 2019: Police
367.article_body: Kashmir recorded a decrease of over 88% in law and order incidents in the three years since the erstwhile state's special status was revoked on August 5, 2019, compared to the preceding three years, police said. The Valley saw 3,686 law and order incidents from 2016 to 2019. In three years from August 5, 2019, the Valley recorded 438 incidents.

368.title: Bollywood needs to pull up their socks: Sonu Sood
368.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has said that South filmmakers have always focused on bringing the audience to the theatres with their extravagant films. When asked if Bollywood needs to pull up their socks, he said, "They need to, I mean everyone needs to...as I think, when you have competition...that's the time you will excel."

369.title: Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit tests positive for COVID-19
369.article_body: As per an official statement, Punjab Governor and Administrator of Chandigarh Banwarilal Purohit has tested positive for COVID-19. Purohit is not showing any serious symptoms, the statement said. All those who came in contact with him are requested to isolate, it added. Purohit had also tested positive for the virus in 2020 while he was the Governor of Tamil Nadu.

370.title: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia wins his 2nd consecutive gold medal at CWG
370.article_body: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia on Friday bagged his second consecutive gold medal at CWG. The 28-year-old defeated Canada's Lachlan McNeil in the final of the men's freestyle 65 kg category at CWG 2022. Bajrang had defeated Wales' Kane Charig in the final at CWG 2018 to bag his first CWG gold. Bajrang had won a silver medal at CWG 2014.

371.title: Won't pretend to be Shah Rukh Khan's Raj: DDLJ musical's Austin Colby
371.article_body: British actor Austin Colby, who'll play the character based on Shah Rukh Khan's Raj in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge's Broadway musical adaptation, has responded to criticism around his casting. "I'm aware what my involvement in this production means to...people. I'm not...Raj that Shah Rukh Khan made us fall in love with, nor will I ever pretend to be," Austin said.

372.title: We were detained in undemocratic way, it's not a good sign: Sachin Pilot
372.article_body: Sachin Pilot, along with other Congress leaders, including Priyanka and Rahul Gandhi, was detained in Delhi on Friday for holding protests against inflation and unemployment. On being released after six hours, Pilot said, "The way we're detained in an undemocratic way isn't a good sign." "By fixing the accountability of government, it's our responsibility to question them," he added.

373.title: Indian table tennis player Sathiyan enters men's singles pre-quarters at CWG
373.article_body: Indian paddler Sathiyan Gnanasekaran beat Paul McCreery of Northern Ireland to enter men's singles pre-quarterfinal at Commonwealth Games 2022. Sathiyan won with a scoreline of 11-9, 11-9, 12-10, 13-11 in the round of 32. Meanwhile, Sathiyan and mixed doubles partner Manika Batra lost in the mixed doubles quarter-final. Malaysia's Choong Javen and Lyne Karen defeated the Indian team 3-2.

374.title: Lost jewels found in remains of Spanish ship that sank over 350 years ago
374.article_body: Jewel-encrusted pendants and gold chains are among the priceless artefacts that were found among the remains of a Spanish ship which sank over 350 years ago in the Bahamas. The lost treasure was found recently by Bahamian and US marine archaeologists and divers. They were found among a debris trail spanning over 13 km near the Little Bahama Bank.

375.title: Ashwin-Chahal complement each other; don't see Kuldeep coming in: Sanjay
375.article_body: Former player Sanjay Manjrekar has commented on the combination of spinners Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. "Ashwin focused...on the economy, but when you have...Chahal...then Ashwin becomes a great complement because he has mastered the art of being economical in T20 cricket," Manjrekar said. He added that the combination of Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav will never be "employed" again.

376.title: Lightning strike near White House leaves 2 dead and 2 injured
376.article_body: Two people were killed and two others were injured in a lightning strike in Lafayette Square near the White House, police said on Friday. The lightning struck them on Thursday near a tree that stands yards away from the fence that surrounds the White House, according to Reuters. A thunderstorm had swept through Washington DC earlier in the day.

377.title: 21-year-old Anshu Malik wins silver, India's 1st medal in wrestling at CWG 2022
377.article_body: Wrestler Anshu Malik bagged India's first wrestling medal at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 after clinching silver following her defeat to two-time CWG gold medallist Odunayo Folasade Adekuoroye in the women's freestyle 57 kg event. The 21-year-old was featuring in her first-ever CWG. Anshu had beaten Sri Lanka's Nethmi Poruthotage in the semi-final of the event.

378.title: Russian President Putin hosts Turkish counterpart Erdogan in Sochi
378.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted his Turkish counterpart Recep Erdogan in Sochi on Friday. The war in Ukraine and the situation in Syria were said to be on the agenda. This is the second meeting between the leaders since Turkey supported an agreement between Russia and Ukraine last month to provide a safe sea route to ship trapped grain stocks.

379.title: South Africa reports 1st death causally linked to COVID-19 vaccine
379.article_body: South Africa's health regulator on Thursday said that a causal link has been established between the death of an individual due to neurological disorder Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS) and Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine. The person developed GBS shortly after taking the vaccine, senior scientists informed. "At the time of illness, no other cause for GBS could be identified," they said.

380.title: J&K logs 823 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths reported
380.article_body: Jammu & Kashmir reported 823 new cases of COVID-19 on Friday, taking the union territory's active case count to 5,133, officials informed. The union territory also recorded two fatalities due to the infection. According to officials, Jammu division logged 190 cases on Friday, whereas 633 cases were reported from the Kashmir valley.

381.title: Congress protesting in black clothes an insult to Ram Bhakts: UP CM Yogi
381.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticised Congress for protesting against the government in black clothes on Ayodhya Diwas and said, "It's an insult to...the Ram Bhakts." He said, "Until now, Congress was protesting in normal attire, but today they protested wearing black clothes...They chose this day [Ayodhya Diwas] which marks the beginning of the construction of Ram Janambhoomi."

382.title: 1 dead, 14 injured after grenade attack in Balochistan's Quetta
382.article_body: A grenade attack on Thursday night in the Balochistan province of Pakistan left at least one person dead and 14 others injured, local media reported on Friday. The incident reportedly occurred when unidentified motorcyclists hurled a grenade at roadside stalls in Quetta's Joint road area. No militant group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far, media reports said.

383.title: Rahul, other Congress leaders released after 6-hr detention in Delhi
383.article_body: Congress leaders including Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor and KC Venugopal were released from a police station in Delhi after being detained for almost six hours on Friday. They had been detained under Delhi Police Act while protesting against inflation, GST and unemployment. "[We have] been released after being detained...for protesting peacefully," Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said.

384.title: Indian men's team reaches final of 4x400m relay event at CWG 2022
384.article_body: Indian men's relay team of Muhammed Anas Yahiya, Noah Nirmal Tom, Muhammed Ajmal Variyathodi and Amoj Jacob qualified for the 4x400 metres final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The Indian team finished second in heat two, clocking 3:06.97. Kenya topped the heat, with a timing of 3:06.76. The final will be held on Sunday.

385.title: Israel launches air strikes in Gaza, 5-year-old girl among 7 killed
385.article_body: Israel on Friday said it has launched airstrikes on Gaza, which reportedly killed at least seven people and injured another 40, following heightened tensions in the occupied West Bank. A five-year-old girl was among those killed in the strike, the Palestinian Health Ministry said. An Islamic Jihad group militant named Tayseer Jabari was also among those killed, Israel confirmed.

386.title: Nadal withdraws from Montreal tennis event due to abdominal strain
386.article_body: Former world number one Rafael Nadal has withdrawn from next week's ATP 1000 event in Montreal, Canada due to an ongoing abdominal strain. "I am very sad not to...play a tournament that I have won five times," the 36-year-old Spaniard said. Notably, the same injury forced the 22-time Grand Slam champion to miss his Wimbledon semi-final last month.

387.title: Congress' 'black protest' subtle message against Ram Mandir's construction: Shah
387.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday questioned the choice of Congress leaders to wear black clothes during their protests on the anniversary of PM Narendra Modi laying the foundation stone of Ram Mandir. Shah claimed that the move was a subtle way of conveying Congress' opposition to temple's construction. This was done "to further promote their appeasement politics", he added.

388.title: PV Sindhu reaches her 3rd consecutive women's singles quarters at CWG
388.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu reached her third consecutive women's singles quarter-final at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham on Friday. The 27-year-old Indian shuttler defeated Uganda's Husina Kobugabe 21-10, 21-9 in the round of 16. Sindhu, the last edition's silver medallist in the singles, will face Malaysia's Goh Jin Wei in the quarter-final on Saturday.

389.title: 6 countries interested in buying India's Tejas fighter jets, govt releases list
389.article_body: The government on Friday said that state-owned Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has offered to sell 18 Tejas fighter jets to Malaysia, adding that six other nations are interested in buying them. Argentina, Australia, Egypt, the United States of America, Indonesia and the Philippines have expressed an interest in buying the light-combat aircraft (LCA), the Defence Ministry said.

390.title: Took dictionary to censor board to explain ch****a isn't gaali: Anurag on Satya
390.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap revealed that he carried a Hindi dictionary to explain a word to the censor board when his 1998 film 'Satya' went for screening. He shared a video that explained how the word 'ch****a' isn't an abusive term, writing, "That's a major truth. During...censor screening of SATYA, I carried...Hindi dictionary to explain the same...that ch****a isn't a gaali."

391.title: Anupam meets Rajamouli in Hyderabad, actor says 'love your simplicity'
391.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher recently met SS Rajamouli and his wife Rama Rajamouli at their residence in Hyderabad. He took to Instagram to thank the 'RRR' director for hosting him for lunch at his place. Anupam also shared a video where he could be seen wrapping a traditional shawl around Rajamouli's shoulders. "I love your simplicity and humility," Anupam wrote.

392.title: Former Pakistan minister spits on live TV during debate, video goes viral
392.article_body: Former Pakistan minister Sheikh Rasheed Ahmad spat during a live television debate, the footage of which has gone viral. This came after Ahmad was asked a question about the current Interior Minister of Pakistan Rana Sanaullah. "His new portfolio should be: minister for spitting on live TV," wrote journalist Naila Inayat while sharing the video.

393.title: Raped by father, 13-yr-old girl delivers baby in Tamil Nadu's Vellore
393.article_body: A 44-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 13-year-old daughter in Tamil Nadu's Vellore district. The matter came to light when the minor complained about stomach ache and was taken to a government hospital. Upon questioning, the girl told police that she had been repeatedly raped by her father for the past 10 months.

394.title: Flash floods killed 550 in Pakistan over past month: Govt agency
394.article_body: Pakistan's National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) on Friday said that flash floods caused by abnormally heavy monsoon rains killed at least 550 people in the country over the past month. The floods had damaged more than 46,200 houses, it added. "We're doing our best to provide for extensive relief and rehabilitation of flood victims," Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif said.

395.title: National-record holder Jyothi fails to qualify for 100m hurdles final at CWG
395.article_body: India's Jyothi Yarraji failed to qualify for the women's 100 metres hurdles final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The 22-year-old clocked 13.18 seconds to finish fourth in heat two. Jamaica's Megan Tapper topped the heat, clocking 12.68 seconds. Notably, Jyothi is the national record-holder. She clocked 13.04 seconds to set the record.

396.title: South Korea launches its first lunar orbiter
396.article_body: South Korea launched its first lunar orbiter, Korea Pathfinder Lunar Orbiter, nicknamed Danuri, on Friday. The orbiter was launched on SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket from Florida's Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. It is expected to enter the moon's orbit in December and start a year-long observation mission to search for possible landing sites, conduct research on the lunar environment etc.

397.title: Hoping best players play international cricket as often as they can: ICC CEO
397.article_body: ICC CEO Geoff Allardice said he hopes that the best cricketers often play international cricket. "There'll still be all-format players...whether they play every match...is a different question," Geoff said. He added, "The balance of players playing international cricket versus domestic leagues will continue to evolve." Recently, Ben Stokes retired from ODIs citing an "unsustainable" schedule.

398.title: Ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, Arpita sent to jail for 14 days
398.article_body: A Kolkata court on Friday sent former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee to a 14-day judicial custody in connection with the West Bengal teacher recruitment scam case. The two will remain in jail till August 18. The Enforcement Directorate's lawyer told the court that the agency needs to interrogate them over new findings in the case.

399.title: Husbands take oath as wives elected to panchayat in MP, probe ordered
399.article_body: A Scheduled Caste woman was recently elected as Sarpanch after elections at Madhya Pradesh's Gaisabad Panchayat, Damoh. Some other women were also elected as panchayat members. A video showed that instead of the women, their husbands and other male relatives allegedly took oath in the swearing-in ceremony. Zila Panchayat CEO Ajay Shrivastava ordered an enquiry after the video went viral.

400.title: I was suicidal at times: Deepika Padukone on battling depression
400.article_body: Deepika Padukone recently talked about the time when she was battling depression. Speaking at an event, she said, "I would break down for no reason...I would sleep because sleep for me was an escape. I was suicidal at times." "Even now when my parents visit me, I always put on a brave front that everything's okay," she added.

401.title: Over 300, including 65 MPs, detained during Congress protest in Delhi
401.article_body: Around 335 people, including 65 Members of Parliament (MPs) were detained in Delhi on Friday, amid Congress' protest against price rise and GST. The detentions were made under the Delhi Police Act, police said, adding, "Intimation about detention...is being sent to the respective competent authorities." Rahul Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor and Priyanka Vadra were among those detained.
